Absolutely ridiculous that 90% of your grade is from exams- definitely the worst professor I've had so far

You can receive up to 6% bonus just for doing the top hat questions and SEI. The tests were not super hard, and there were only 25 questions + 2 extra credit questions on each midterm. There are three midterms and a final, but the lowest grade is dropped. Recitation counts for participation, but they drop 2 of them.

Going to lectures gets you the extra credit through answering tophat questions, although,  the lectures are often confusing and rushed. She also posts her lectures online so if you can't go you can watch them later. I had to use outside resources to understand the material because she was not super clear when explaining topics.
Easy exams. But hard to learn. She makes everything more difficult to understand, and lectures have no logic at all.

So she makes these powerpoints that are unrelated to the test half of the time and in class she is either sprinting through the powerpoint, or writing on a piece of paper some random graphs that are super confusing but the tests aren't too hard and if you go to class, tophat is worth 5% extra credit
Grossly unorganized and scatter-brained. Really annoying and goes way too fast. Would not recommend.
She is a fantastic teacher.

Darcy was a decent professor. She lectures a lot and goes off on tangents frequently. If you go to lecture and/or read the book you should get an A easily. There are 4 exams that make up 90% of your grade and you drop the lowest one.

Pretty good professor very laid back & easy going, go to lecture and you can receive up to 5% extra credit,  tests are pretty easy and all multiple choice with two bonus questions on every test. Definitely would recommend Darcy if you have to take macro, also takes your 3 best test scores (/4) so you can get out of taking a final

I took this class online and found it to be pretty easy.  Not much homework at all, and the exams were similar in difficulty to the practice exams she posted.  She also offered over 5% extra credit in the class.  I would highly recommend taking this class online.

Dr. Hartman is a really nice person. She gives out extra credit for doing 5/6 of the homework assignments and sometimes for showing up to class when not a lot of people are there. Her lectures can be boring when she is reading off the PowerPoints. There is a group project and a paper, but as someone else mentioned, she is a lenient grader.

Professor Hartman makes it really easy for you to pass the class if you attend lecture. Even if you don't, she posts online lectures and powerpoints so that you can catch up if you miss lecture. Overall, she was always really happy when she was talking about economics and talked about current events that corresponded with curriculum well.

Darcy is a really nice woman who knows her stuff, but she is not the best lecturer. I went to every lecture and found that she simply read directly from the slides without actually teaching anything. I did well on the exams only because I learned everything from my TA and taught myself.

Prof. Hartman was an easy teacher who did not care if you came to class. Her exams were easy and she loves to give extra credit. There were group presentations and a paper but other than that most points came from exams

She is really good! She's nice in office hours, actually helps and doesn't seem annoyed. Exams are easy. 25 questions each. Offers up to 5% of extra credit. Speaks English. Personally I'm doing a lot better in macro than micro. She decided to switch to a $24 textbook from the $150--really awesome. Applies concepts to real world.

Dr. Hartman knows her stuff. There were 4 tests lowest one dropped. Those were 90% of your grade. Go to lecture and you'll do fine. Tests will test your understanding of the topic. She provides study guides, online aids, lecture supplements, and practice tests.
She is the worst. Do not go to class.
shes really boring to listen to. don't.

She appeared very disorganized and rushed through most of her slides every class. Recitation is required and is worth 5% of your grade give 5% extra credit. Don't go to class just read the book and you will be fine. Easy A.

Easy A. Never taken a more easier class. Professor Hartman gives so much extra credits! You don't need to go the lectures, just study the ppts! I did that and finished with a 98%. She gives a total of 3 midterms + a final and drop your lowest grates! :)

I went to lecture like 3 times this whole semester. She really does read off the ppt so you can just watch the podcast. She's a nice lady but I just wish she could explain a little more rather than just reading the ppt. But if you need help, I'm sure she'll be more than willing to help you. Its a easy class if you put a good amount of time into it.
She literally reads through the slides. I don't even listen because her voice is annoying. I think the online version is much easier because the review guide is the final exam. Super easy.

I wish I got paid to show up and teach the textbook slideshows that come standard with our access code like Darcy does. She rushes through the slides and just reads off of them. Lectures aren't helpful, only for extra credit. Exams are fairly straightforward and as long as you read the book/power points/ go to recitation you'll do just fine.

Amazing professor! Her lectures are consistently interesting (if macroeconomics interests you) and taking this class definitely helped me decide on economics as my business specialization. Her exams are relatively simple and straight-forward, so as long as you make a reasonable effort, an A is definitely attainable. Definitely one of my favorites.

Makes you do one group project and one research paper, but she's an easy grader. There are three midterms but if you ace them all then you don't have to take the final, otherwise your lowest exam grade is dropped. There is extra credit opportunities. I never bought the textbook and I aced all the midterms and got an easy A.

Her lectures are pointless. I got an A for the class with only reviewing from ppts she uploads. She basically reads off the ppts during the lecture, which makes her lectures extremely boring. Gives extra credit and bonus questions though along with super easy exams.

Really nice lady. Don't bother going to lectures because she has to speed through the power points and they are online anyways. Read the book and go to the Econ Learning center for help. All of the midterms are easy and the extra credit questions do come from the lecture. Make sure to do all of the online quizzes and homework too.

Midterms are super easy as long as you read the material. Lectures are extremely boring and unnecessary - if you read the text you won't need to attend. However, extra credit questions on the midterms are over facts she  mentions during class that you likely would not know otherwise. Overall, the class is very easy and not much work is needed.

Took the online version of this course. Pearson online was used for the textbook/homework/quizzes. The lectures and slides are very helpful and straightforward, but there were many conceptual questions that were answered in the textbook only.

ECON2002.01 (Macroeconomics) is a college class taught at a 6th grade level. Every midterm is a joke. I made a quizlet from the study guides (the folders are called "OSU ECON2002.01 Midterm 1, 2, and 3" respectively if you want to use them) and got an A every time. Skim the textbook and you'll be fine. Lecture attendance is not mandatory.

I'll admit it, her lectures aren't the most interesting. However, she's very helpful when you reach out to her and she doesn't try to throw you any curve balls on her tests. If you're looking for an easier econ class, Darcy is the way to go.
I really like this professor, she is funny and she generally gives good feedback
Enjoyed thoroughly.

Dr. Hartman is a great professor.  She is very interested in our current economy, and she regularly prints out articles of things going on in the real world and we read them in class.  There were 6 homework assignments that you do for extra credit.  There is one group project and one individual research paper, but she is a lenient grader. Take her!

She means well. The class is easy enough. Aced all the midterms and did not have to take the final. She does go very quickly through lectures and her ppts contain a lot of text. Very difficult to take notes in lecture. Make sure you read the book and go to recitation. Overall though, you'll be fine with Hartman. No reason to switch.

For lectures, she speeds through the Powerpoint slides, but they're on Carmen, so lecture is virtually pointless. Recitation is mandatory and also useless. As long as you review the slides and read the textbook, you shouldn't have much of a problem. The midterms are super easy and there are extra credit questions.

Nice but, Lectures are boring and PPTs not helpful. IF YOU READ THE TEXT you do not need to go to lecture. She drops your lowest midterm score. The final was REALLY easy. There is weekly online homework and quizzes. (Quiz answers are online sometimes or directly from textbook.) Recitation is mandatory and not helpful. Just read the text for an A...
Difficult to listen to because of her somewhat monotone voice.
Everything is pretty much straight from the book. Midterms aren't that bad. Lots of extra credit, easy A.

She pretty much just reads off the slides during lecture and her microphone isn't loud enough, so lecture is really boring. I didn't really listen in class and I just studied a lot for the midterms. Just do your homework, do the quizzes, go to recitation, & really study what she puts on the midterm reviews and you should be fine!

Dr. Hartman is a very approachable and kind professor. Her tests are fair and there is a lot of extra credit available. Sometimes her notes are a bit unstructured, so reading the book definitely helps. Overall not a terribly difficult class.

Darcy is a wonderful lady and very kindcaring. If you get an A or A- on the three multiple choice midterms you dont have to take the final. She is understanding and easy to talk to in office hours. The book is a must to do good. Read it. TAs are completely useless.

This class was an easy A with Darcy, her lectures are clear (even though she does move fast) and midterms are not difficult and grading for the class is easy. The final was just like the midterms! Take Macro with Darcy!

The class was a mess, she even admitted she wasn't prepared to teach an online class and did not like the program quizzes and ended up adjusting the course half way through. She does not provide help or feed back just one video per week where she does a very easy problem, nothing like the exams. DO NOT AKE THIS COURSE ONLINE.

She means well, but during her lectures she essentially just reads the class the slides provided by the textbook.  The pace of the class is very fast, there is not much time to take notes, but I guess that's okay because you'll have access to the powerpoints. I would not take another one of her classes.

She's pretty good for someone who has to teach 535 students, and she's personable too. My biggest complaint is that I don't think she turns up the microphone enough in that big hall. Sometimes she goes over material a bit quickly, but overall it's definitely manageable.

Means well, but class is mostly just her reading the slides that get put on Carmen. Biggest warning is this class has one speed: Fast! Don't count on getting all the day's notes during lecture, it won't happen. The class will also stay at this speed throughout the whole semester except for test days and the day right before.
Super easy class if you pay attention in lecture or study the book. Got As on all midterms and didn't have to take the final. She's really nice and her lectures explain the subject matter well.

Dr. Hartman is a great teacher. I think she does an excellent job of breaking down the material. This class is extremely easy if you give a damn and pay attention. Hartman is sweet and attractive in a Mother ILFy kind of way. All you have to do is take notes and go to recitation. I got As on all of the midterms and I didn't have to take the final.

She is boring and class is really long and useless. Online quizzes each week are easy. You have a paper to write.  Midterms are just alright; not entirely difficult, but not super easy.  Once again, she is very boring!

Excellent professor. She is very clear about her expectations and provides students with many opportunities to get a good grade. Her midterms are fairly easy and straightforward. Tries to keep lectures interesting for the most part.
Easy class. All you had to do was read the book and you can get a very high grade. Her lectures can be boring, but she is good at explaining if you need help.
Fun to work with and so hawt
Good professor to have if you are not majoring in Econ because she is pretty easy.  She is a super nice person but not an interesting lecturer.  Classes are pretty boring. fairly easy A.

Dr. Hartman is an awesome professor but an even better teacher, probably one of the best I've had in college so far. She breaks the material down and is more than willing to help students that need extra help.
If you can choose another teacher, then do it. She goes very fast and the classes are useless. You need to read the book all on yourself. and you need to write a paper.

This class was way harder than it needed to be. Felt like I had to teach myself the material many times. Quizzes are all online, homework is for extra credit, but her exams can be difficult. She also speaks in a really low voice so most times it was hard for me to hear her, let alone stay awake in her class. She's really nice though.

This class is super boring, but it's really easy. Her exams are pretty straight forward. She gives helpful practice problems online on an overpriced website that you have to buy access to for homework and quizzes. She's really nice and willing to help if you have any questions though!

She writes all the notes on the board during each class, which is helpful. But she goes SO fast. The entire class is basically writing a ton and not really absorbing much. You need to read the book and your notes regularly to stay on top of things. She gives 5 homework's for extra credit and weekly online quizzes.
This class was way harder than it needed to be.
Nice and likes the topic.  Can get boring but worth going to class. quizes and exams are worded difficult. reading textbook helps a lot

I went to almost all the lectures but it wasn't necessary. Homework (5 sets of practice problems) was very easy (not graded) and for extra credit. Easy online quizzes. I ended up teaching myself things because she wasn't always clear. Nice woman though.

She was an okay teacher. She did not really help much. Could be a little ditzy at times but had really  good fashion. I think she was easier than the other macro econ professors so i would suggest her. Tests could be difficult if you just studied the notes

Freakonomics is really fun and interesting, that being said Darcy has the strangest techniques I've ever seen. Her tests are all multiple choice and quizzes were EC but I feel like she wrote her questions while in a questionable state, they rarely made sense. I'd still take this class again though! Gotta love Darcy!

Freakenomics class was pretty fun. Class was interesting, with a pure mutiple choice midterm. Felt a bit like high school at times with some of the movies but she was overall a fun teacher. If you show up to class, you should pass

Much like the other reviews say, Dempsey is a nice guy and is passionate about what he teaches. However, he does not translate the conceptual style of his lectures into solving economic problems (i.e. those on his exams) very well at all. You are not taught how to actually apply the material to the things that matter. I don't recommend him.

This is a tough class. Dempsey does not write a lot of problems or give much practice material. He is not very accessible outside of class. During lecture, he spends too much time on simple concepts and speeds through the difficult material. You can learn enough to do well if you read the textbook and teach yourself.

I had Kyle Dempsey for ECON 4002.02 (Intermediate Macroeconomic Theory). The course consisted of one quiz, weekly problem sets, two midterm exams, and a final exam. The course was conducted online, and the midterm exams and final exam were proctored via Zoom. Prof. Dempsey was relatively unavailable outside of office hours. Doesn't allow appts.

I was highly impressed by Professor Dempsey especially since this was his first semester. He handled online classes extremely well and was always accessible. As for difficulty and grading, the top 15% of students received and A in my class. If you want to go to grad school for Econ, take Dempsey. He offers a true intro to real high level econ!

Solid guy. You can tell he's passionate about the course material and really cares about and wants his students to understand the material as well. Brings really good energy to his lectures and great about answering any questions students have.

well, i wouldn't recommend this instructor. she's not difficult conceptually (it's just micro). but she's not a good teacher. she feels like a total academic with little if any real world experience. and i didn't feel like she enjoyed teaching - it was a grind for her and the students. use the book and skip the class or you'll be so bored.

It would be hard to recommend Xiaomin Bian. I had her for 202. She has no enthusiasm for the subject. Her classes are a grind - dull and long. Truthfully, I'd skip the lectures, follow the text and take the tests. And be glad when it's over. She's not a good instructor and the classes are dreary.

Professor Xiaomin Bian is an ok teacher. I believe she knows economics pretty well but her lectures are quite dull. She primarily drives towards math solutions and you can sometimes forget the point. Like you know how to follow the steps but don't know why it matters. She's nice though - not mean and grades fairly. Just dull.

My class with Xiaomin Bian was canned lectures. Her lectures were long, dull. Her material was taken directly from 2 prominent textbooks. We had 3 office hours per week. If you like to study on your own and are just paying for a credential, she may be ok. If you expect your teacher to teach, it's a fail. She is a mediocre lecturer at best.

Prof. Bian knew her stuff but man, sitting through her lectures was torture. She rambles about the simplest concepts forever and then I would be missing concepts during the homework and quizzes/exams. If you take her, I recommend going over the textbook before you watch her lectures. Or maybe just skip the lectures and read the text.

It feels like Professor Bian did not care about teaching this class at all. The pre-recorded lectures from last spring felt impersonal and met the bare minimum amount of teaching. Although the work was not hard, the lectures were EXTREMELY long and time-consuming. Overall, I recommend taking this class in person with any other professor.

Although it technically had a scheduled meeting time, she made the class asynchronous. I didn't watch any lecture videos and just read the slides by myself and did fine. Do the practice problems she posts and you should be good. I spent maybe an hour max on this class every week.

Class is asynchronous with pre-recorded lectures probably from last spring. Lectures are long for no reason and can get boring. Her class consists of quizzes, homework, and exams. Unlimited attempts on the homework, but only 1 attempt on quizzes. Exams make up the majority of your grade with 2 midterms and 1 final but not very difficult.

I don't recommend taking this class online. The professor posted pre-recorded lectures from last spring, so there was no student/professor interaction. The lecture videos are very long, so plan your time accordingly.

Prof Bian is solid. Even though this class was asynchronous, I learned quite a lot. Weekly quizzes and homework, and two exams throughout the semester; all assignments were very fair and very related to class material. Lectures are LONG, and can get boring. She gives tons of extra practice though and explains difficult concepts in helpful detail.

One of the toughest classes at OSU, the professor teaches very complex material but does not go over how to graph nonlinear functions and equations. Overall, if you have a lot of time to spare to teach yourself take it. She is nice but has a hard time to simplify the information down.
Easy A. With many practice questions and samples related to the exam and quizzes. Curves a lot!
Ms. Bian is a very good lecturer but makes the content very difficult for her students. She goes very quickly so be sure to read chapters earlier. Most averages are 60% or lower.
Her lectures are amazingly helpful if you listen. Respect students and give fast feedbacks.
GOAT. Care about students.

The course is hard but the professor helps a lot in understanding. She is nice and patient and willing to listen to students' comments. Quick and good feedbacks. Fast grades submission. She gives many extra credits. I would recommend.
This is a conceptually challenging class, but professor Bian cares a lot about helping the students understand the concepts and adds many extra credit points.

She is great! I really learned a lot from her. She sent her own slides every week and those are clear. Grades submissions are finished the day exams finished. She loves teaching I think. Really recommend her.

Xiaomin is extremely excellent in explaining materials. She has slides for recitations which are clear and nice. I learn much more in her recitation than the instructor's lecture. She replies emails in a minute and submits grades no later than the day the exam finishes. Her explanations are inspiring.
Great guy, the exams are hard so study for them
Great guy, the exams are hard.

Exams are very difficult. Studied both exams for over 6 hours each and did terrible on both. The questions are highly specific and obscure. It almost seems like he is trying to fail students or make the class more difficult than it already is. In both exams, I hadn't seen the information from the course for 30% of the questions. Thanks Bruce!

Professor Bellner is a nice guy, but the content can get dry. The exams are tricky, so be sure to study hard and utilize resources like the textbook and Unstuck AI to prepare. If you put in the effort, you can do well in this class.

Even as an online course, you could tell this guy cared about his students. Was appreciative of discussion board posts, and gave exam study tips. Not an overly difficult class if you put in the work. Highly recommend

Good lecturer and cares about his students the content was pretty dry and was brutal to follow at 8am but he posts his lectures so i was able to go back and review the content at my own pace which helped a lot homework was pretty light with only 3 assignments a week but the exams were sneaky tough definitely be ready to study a bit

I would suggest taking this class in person if possible, it's not as engaging online. Weekly readings accompanied by warm-ups, quizzes, and simulations, with biweekly discussion posts aren't too hard to keep up with. The two exams are worth 60% of your grade and he doesn't round or give extra credit so you gotta do good on those.

Pretty easy to keep up with, a chapter or two a week fairly short just take notes and the homework and quizzes will be easy. The tests are worded strange sometimes and kind of confusing. Bellner was cool he sent out weekly reminders.

He is extremely nice and even for an 8AM lecture, he is enthusiastic and tries to make the course engaging. The material wasn't extremely difficult, there was just a lot of it. Attendance is graded so go for easy points and the homework was pretty simple too.
Prof. Bellner was a solid professor, but the class itself is sneaky tough. Two exams are pretty heavy, and some of the exam questions are a little odd. Overall easy B hard A, but Bellner is solid.

Dr. Bellner really showed the he cares about his students even through an online setting. That being said, the course is going to challenge you, especially the exams, as both are worth 30%. It's really hard to get an A in this class but if you put in the work then you'll be fine. This class is definitely an easy B but difficult A.
Good professor, study for the exams as they count for a lot of the grade.

Bruce is such a nice guy and a great lecturer even at 8am.  Unfortunately, the content for this class is pretty boring and there is a LOT you memorize for the exams. I found the exams to be tricky, but if you study you'll do fine. I got an A studying my ass off for the midterm, and then a B- on the final because I barely studied. Easy B, hard A!

Professor Bellner was a super nice guy, but his lectures were a snooze fest. Your whole grade is pretty much based on two exams that were way harder then I was expecting for a class that every business major must take. You have a lot of easy homework assignments each week, but they really do nothing for your grade.

Overall, not a bad class. Take the exams seriously though because they are weighted pretty heavy considering the fact that the only other assignments were easy Pearson quizzes. Overall, I think he's a nice guy and cares about his students. Sometimes his lectures were a little boring but nothing unbearable.

Prof. Bellner is one of the most under rated professors at I've had while attending OSU. He is very passionate. Top Hat is required during his lectures (80 min long X 2). I'd avoid taking his early morning class as sometimes his class is repetive/monotone. Exams (60% of grade) are straight-forward and contain a lot of questions from prior quizzes.

I took the 4 week summer session and it was pretty smooth sailing. Bellner seems like a nice guy and he grades in a timely manner. It's really easy to pass the class even with less-than-stellar midterm/final grades as long as you complete all other assignments.

Only real way to succeed in this class is to read the textbook- there is no way around it. The textbook explains the material better than his lectures (not really necessary to watch them). The online textbook does allow you to copy & paste, which is nice if you type your notes. The midterm was quite difficult, but the final was not nearly as hard.

Whoever said the exams weren't like the quizzes was lying! For the exams rewatch the lecture videos and practice the quiz questions. You must study. There should only be two or three curve balls on the exam. I never read the textbook as everything he says in lectures is in there. Sadly ended with a 92.5 and there is no curve :(
Actually a great guy, I would *optionally* take another class with Prof. Bellner.

The only complaint about this class would be the exams. The questions are nothing like the quizzes. HOWEVER, if you really read the chapters and study the material FROM THE TEXTBOOK, you'll do just fine. If you don't do too well on the exams, go to Dr. Bellner's office hours to go over the exam, he's very supportive and will help you succeed!

Bellner is super nice and cares about his students, but 8 am lectures made it hard to focus. IB was a pretty straightforward class with weekly assignments and two heavily weighted exams. He was accommodating and allowed me to take them a day early. I didn't do as well as I should have on those, but nonetheless he's a solid professor.
This class is extremely easy. The layout was also extremely organized. You'll do perfectly fine in this class if you put in even a bit of effort.

Lectures were straightforward. If you put in a little bit of effort studying the lecture materials for the exams, you will do just fine. Just make sure to know all the different theories and what they mean. Pretty easy class honestly.

Assignments besides the 2 exams are all super easy A's ... only thing that might bring your grade down is the exams but even those are relatively easy compared to most courses. No complaints for Prof. Bellner
Super nice guy and ends up adding a curve. Exams are somewhat difficult but all other assignments are easy and quick.

8 a.m's are not the way to go, but he does take attendance and TopHat quizzes every lecture, so there's some motivation. Lectures 50% material that's important and 50% fun fact stats, so the book is important. LearnSmart assignments are a huge help with midterm and exam as well.

Prepare to do lots of mandatory, online homework for this class, but it's beneficial. The homework really prepares you well for the exams. I actually wish all the business classes operated this way. His curves are generous on the exams. Overall, International Business turned out to be an easy class if you just do the work.

Bruce is a pretty good professor, I took his online IB class and I really enjoyed it. You have to watch about 3 hours of lectures every week and about 1 hour of homework. You do not need to read the textbook but you should know the vocab for the exams. Overall, I liked Bruce as a professor especially online, but it was not as easy as I was told.

Bruce is an awesome person who really cares about his job and his students. His exams are weighted heavily and require alot of excessive reading. You basically have to memorize blocks of texts which is really annoying. Although that sucks, Bruce does his best to make it the best class it can be.
Very easy for a fisher class. Tests are multiple choice, but somewhat tricky. Read the textbook and do the weekly assignments.

One word, boring. Dr. Bellner is very interested in this course but having it at 8am really killed the vibe. He also took attendance which sucked. Lectures are boring and you really don't need to go unless he is taking attendance. Exams are pure information regurgitation with a little bit of information you have to read in the book. He curves.

Good teacher & gives you a reasonable amount of material to be responsible for on the exams. The only issue is- the exams are super hard. random questions are pulled from the book when we werere Required to purchase the book.

He's such a nice guy and he is clearly always thrilled to be there every day. He loves the subject and teaching. It was unfortunate that this class was at 8 am and on south campus (far from the business school) because it meant not a lot of people showed up to his lectures. I think the 80 min lectures make it hard to focus.

Easy quizzes/activities that are very just completion based and you just have to make sure to stay on top of. Other than that, 2 exams where if you watch the lecture and do his study guides you should be fine.

Bruce Bellner's class was fairly straightforward. If you watch the lecture videos, you should get at least an A- in the class. There was a textbook, but you do not need to read it. The lectures cover everything you need. I would say, however, the exams are quite difficult, but if you study adequately, you should do pretty well. Would recommend

Lecture is only graded on three exams and attendance. Lectures are incredibly boring as is the whole class, why this is required to graduate is beyond me. When maybe half the class shows up every lecture you'd think it's an indication that no one care about the class.

Exams aren't hard if you study a little bit; all from slides, don't really need book. Attendance taken by TopHat. A few group projects throughout the class but nothing super time-consuming. Overall, a pretty easy class if you put in the work.

Very easy class. 3 group case write-ups, 1 group presentation, some online hw weekly but easy. Try to take the online lecture version, then class only once a week. Need to show up for tophat code but don't really need to pay attention in class. 3 MC exams, pretty easy if you memorize slides night before. Easy grader on group work. Really caring

Bruce Bellner was great as a professor for a senior class like 4490. He was very thought provoking and really cared about students. The class was very easy overall, but as kind of Fisher's Senior Capstone, I was okay with that. Bruce Bellner still allowed students to learn and think about strategy in business and I really enjoyed the course overall

Definitely take 4490 with Dr. Bellner if you can. You can watch lectures online or in person. In class recitations apply concepts to cases. Pretty easy grader. Each group does 3 case write-ups and 1 presentation. Exams are pretty straightforward. HW assignments are also pretty easy. For the most part, this was a fairly stress-free course.
Very passionate about teaching and truly cares about his students. Well spoken, knowledgable and understanding. Enjoyed having him as a professor.

Bruce is fairly laid back. Takes attendance for every class, but lectures are pretty boring and everything he goes over is on the slides. Just re-read the slides before the quizzes. Can find the book as a pdf online. Biggest downside is all the cases to read. All the questions for the cases are done as a group so not too bad. One group project.
If you can take this online, do it. Professor is very nice and timely in responding to emails.

Genuinely nice but not a good professor. Lectures are useless but you have to go for attendance credit. All of the coursework is generated by Pearson and takes forever. He also takes forever to return grades. Take a different professor if you can.

Nice guy but not a great professor. Insanely boring and hard to stay alert during class. Everything needed to pass is put online (including lectures) but he still makes attendance a decent portion of the grade. Exams are easy but quizzes are very detailed based off of chapter readings. Avoid him if possible

Bruce is a very good professor however, if you can, avoid taking him for International Business. The class is much harder under him than other professors. The online quizzes are very difficult and count for a lot.

Overall easy class. He is a fantastic nice professor who grades easy. Expect a few group papers and a presentation which aren't that hard. Just feels like busy work. Exams are really easy as long as you go through the online slides and chapters a few times. Would recommend taking him over anyone else. Also a fantastic resource for real life

Mr. Bellner is probably my favorite professor to date. He has a very contagious sanguine attitude, creating a laid-back atmosphere. He appreciates you being there and giving it your best effort. Very light coursework. Very kind grader. He's cool and down to earth. If Bruce Bellner is teaching a class you need, TAKE IT! NOW! He's the best, really.

Bruce is the best professor I have met at OSU, he is nice and interesting. He really cares about how his students doing. Easy grader but you can learn a lot from his class. I also take his 4597 in this semester, also is a great class. Take his class, you will not regard! Thanks Bruce!
Don't blow off this class because of all of the easy things you hear about Bruce. Lectures are boring and too hard to pay attention to, not a lot of points available in the class.

Bruce is funny and extremely intelligent.  I took Underground Econ (4597) with him and it was a blast.  The material was pretty easy and we always had fun in class.  The only downside to Bruce is that he is pretty unorganized and doesn't give clear guidelines on his assignments.  But it wasn't too awful because he was a fair grader.

Bruce is a great guy and really cares about students. He isn't there to trick you or hurt your gpa. He puts all the test questions on Carmen so if you study those you will get at least a B in the class. Also gives an easy extra credit assignment worth 5% so do that if you want an A.

Absolutely love Professor Bellner. Easily the best professor I've had at OSU &  his 4597 class is awesome. Super easy grader, and very laid back. This class offers real world application and is interesting AF to be honest. Did not require much effort at all. Lecture attendance isn't required until presentations start.. You will love this class.

he tells you exactly what to expect and the date its due. Directions are clear cut and he grades easy. he isn't too worried about grades he just likes to teach and get everyone into learning what hes teaching

He is a very nice guy.  His lecture can be boring but make sure you show up to get 10/10 on participation/just sign in. Large lecture. DON'T waste money on the textbook. I did fine with just reviewing the slides he posts at the beginning of the class. I actually enjoyed him and would definitely take him for other classes.

Very easy GE course as long as you stay up on the notes. Almost never attended lecture as the only thing he does in class is read the powerpoints which are available online. All the HW, quiz and exam questions are pulled straight out of the test bank so theres no excuse to not do well. If you do go to lectures they are a little dry.
It was one of the best lecture I have ever taken, it was so interesting, inspiring and practical. Professor Bruce was such a nice guy too. The class is the coolest class ever!

I am really tired of the vague instructions. There are totally 5 essays, one presentation, and 2 quizzes (thank god he dropped the last one), to be honest, this is the most hard working class i have ever done. The workload is ok, but just the instructions are too vague and you have to work really hard to follow them. The quiz is extremely detailed.

Ok, I took macroecon with him and the underground economy with him as well. For both classes, he is a lazy teacher. Here are whys: 1. Test are straight out of test banks 2. Doesn't talk much about ppt, but the quizzes are 100% based on ppt. so go figure if the lecture is necessary. He take attendance for lectures. I don't like this type of teacher.

This class is somewhat harder that other gen eds. His test are literally straight out of the test bank so if you just know the answer to the test bank questions you can get a 100%. Lectures aren't that necessary but he's a good guy and they are interesting. The recitations are  pointless, don't bother going the recitation after the exam.
Amazing guy and an amazing lecturer. Always there for the students and made economic topics easy to understand and more interesting. Definitely would take again!

Very good lecturer on an interesting topic. Covers material slowly and is very clear. No textbookoutside reading. Lots of group work and the 2nd half of the semester is just listening to group presentations. 1 research memo, 2 short papers, 1 presentation. Attendance grade matters. Not many assignments in the course. Cares a lot about students.

Professor Bruce is a rarity, he is always available to students and always willing to help. Reflecting back on this class you learn alot through the research paper he has you complete and the presentations you listen to every week. Nice, genuine person that really makes learning interactive, everyone should take his classes.

I took three class teaching by him. Econ 2002, 2367 and 4597. All of them are good. You can learn a lot and get easy A at the same time. He is very helpful. Just 3 paper  need to submit and actually it is the same one you extend and modified for three times.

Bruce is the best macroecon professor at Ohio State. I didn't go to class at all, I only read the book. Which is fine because his lecture slides are made from the same company as the book and don't teach anything new. All of the possible test question are also located in the test bank. Don't forget to do the extra credit. It can boost your grade 5%

He is a great guy and really cares. Exams are not too bad but you need to study the provided material and book and understand the concepts to do well. The Final was harder. Recitation with the TA sucks and hurt my grade the most. He is very chill and makes it known that he only gives clear cut questions and is not trying to trick us or hurt our GPA

Interesting class! There is a group project, a 10 page draft paper, a take home midterm, and a final 15 page paper. The majority of the semester was listening to groups present their projects. Gave attendanceparticipation points at random times. Watched an interesting movie. He's an easy grader. He's such a sweet guy, always talks to students!

I probably went to lecture maybe 5 times all year and will easily make an A in the class. He posts all lecture slides online as well as a test bank that he draws every test question from. Not to mention the EC assignment worth 5 percentage points in the end. If you can choose your macro professor, take Bruce.
Nice guy, easy class
He's the dude that you want for Econ

Great guy. He was recitation teacher for senior capstone which accounts for 60% of the grade.  Gave minimal effort and was able to get 59.5 out of the possible 60 points. Take him if you have the chance.  Interesting discussions as well.

Very easy class and a great teacher. Strongly recommended. Extra credit is given. Not much time needed except for studying a little before exams and some easy homework that does not take long. If you just read the chapters you do not even need to show up to class as class presentations are straight out of the book. Reading the book got me an A
Although most of the lectures are more or less a reading of the power point slides, Bruce makes the material easy to understand and does a more then fair job of preparing you for exams and quizzes.
Very nice guy. Knowledgable and easy to understand. I think he makes a point to make the lectures interesting, especially when covering boring material.

Very kind man. Very knowledgeable about economics, and loves learning new things. He wants you to be creative with your work - write and present something that will be new and fascinating for him.  The class was excellent, and if you try, he will reward you. He does not grade harshly. Highly recommend.
Bruce was one of the nicest teachers Ive had who always had an interest to help the students outside of class. If you have to take an ECON class try your best to get Bruce hes great

He is very knowledgeable and willing to help very student. He also want to communicate with you beyond the material in the class. If you are interested in finance and economics and want to have an international perspective, take him. If you want to go deep into economics, do not take him.

Bruce is seriously one of the NICEST men I have ever met. He's very passionate and wants all of his students to learn and do well. I wish I would have taken the time to get to know him better. If you put in a little effort he was a very easy grader. Lectures are straight from the readings, so attendance isn't important except for participation.

Bruce is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. He's so interested in finance and the economy and is incredibly helpful whenever needed. I highly recommend him as a teacher. Attendance is worth very little, so you don't really need to go to class. Really easy

Great Professor! Although the class is made up of about 500 people he really seems to care about the success of every single student. He's a very nice guy and will help in any way possible. Class is appropriately difficult. He makes all possible test questions available for studying online so study those and the notes and you will be fine.

This is my second issues of contemporary world class and this class definitely has more work load.(reflective paper,draft paper,presentation,final paper,& more) My other 597 class only had extremely easy quizzes that will guarantee you to get full marks. It's not hard but If u are looking for an easier 597 class, I would not recommend this class.

Bruce is the man.  Lectures are clear and concise.  He's genuinely interested in the material which never hurts.  Exams are pretty easy if you follow along with the material.  He provides a study guide for each chapter and puts those questions directly on the exam.  Definitely would recommend.
Easy professor. Interested in what he teaches. Nice guy. Very easy class.

Kinda cheesy sometimes, but he explains things pretty well. Moves through the slides way too fast to write some of the stuff down, but the slides are straight from the book. He gives you a schedule of what he's doing each day, so I'd say take half an hour to read before lecture. You'll get a TON more out of it and it'll be a lot easier.
By far the best professor I've ever had!

Great professor! Follows material from book strictly. Exams have built-in bonus and help boost your grade. 3 MTs and 1 final exam (pretty easy). Rec. attendance = extra credit. Easy tests and homework. Do the reading and this is an extremely easy class. I ended up with a 105%. Remember there are NO grade exceptions, bumps, or curve.

The only classes you need to attend are on the days right before each exam, when he gives a study guide with everything that will be on the test. You don't even really need the books because the exam answers come straight from the Freakonomics study guides on Carmen. He's very nice and clearly loves this course. Extra credit available. Easy A.

This was the easiest class I've ever taken. He's a really nice guy, but there are NO exams so there is literally no incentive to pay attention to lectures, but attendance is taken so half the people there just play computer games. We had a short movie response paper, a final paper and draft, and the easiest group project I've ever done.

The class was broken down into an essay which could stem into your final paper, draft, group project, current event article summary, and attendance. Watched 3 interesting movies. He's very approachable & understanding of your problems. Books suggested but not used. Loved the class, would take another class with him :)
Great prof. Looks straight up like Kenneth from 30 Rock.

Professor Bellner is one of the best I have ever taken at Ohio State. The class is extremely interesting!!!! Bruce goes above and beyond to help even out of Econ class. He is very intelligent. Ask him for book recommendations, he reads many books.
Class is very straight forward. No homework. 1 extra credit. He's worth changing your schedule around for to get into his class.

Bellner is a great professor.  He makes sure that he goes over all of the information on the tests.  There are never surprise questions on his exam that you didn't go over in class.  His exams are pretty easy and a lot of the questions are from the test bank that he posts online.  Take his class!
Very nice guy & great professor. He's very helpful and seems to enjoy his job. I definitely recommend taking his class.
AMAZING! Best professor I will most likely ever have at Ohio State. He is a very genuine guy who loves his job.

This class is overall pretty easy. Tests are pretty straight-forward and not difficult. Going to lecture is pretty boring and pointless because he reads straight off the slides that are online. I never went to class and it was still really easy. Bellner is a real nice guy and is always willing to help you out.

AS FOR THE ATTENDENCE, YOU DONT NEED TO GO TO CLASS AT ALL, EVEN RECITATIONS. JUST MAKE SURE YOU SHOW UP ON EXAM DAYS AND TAKE THE EXAMS. Everything is ONLINE - POWERPOINT SLIDES, LECTURE NOTES, PRACTICE EXAMS ETC. CLASS IS A BIT HARD IF ECON IS NOT YOUR STRONG SUBJECT BUT BRUCE IS A NICE PROFESSOR. TAKE HIM!

SUPER nice guy. I don't particularly like econ, and hated 200 so expected the same.. but hes a great teacher. Very easy to listen to and you can tell he genuinely loves teaching the material. He actually made me not hate having 830a class at hitchcock! very helpful, i would (and have) recommend(ed) him =)

He gives you all of his lecture notes and supplements so you really dont need to go to class.  Reads directly from slides, really boring but easy class.  Study Testbank questions, his exams are nearly identical questions

Proff Bellner is a really nice person. He is very helpful. His classes are intresting. There is a long paper to submit at the end of the class but he will work it out in such a way that by the end of the quarter you have a great paper with not too much of an effort.
Lots of group work.  One big paper.  Good 2nd writing class.
The guy is great, he really cares about helping out his students and strives to make his class best for everyone. Really just a generally nice guy.

Not the most interesting subject in the world but his tests are pretty easy.  Homework isn't for a grade, your only grade is 3 tests but he does give extra credit.  Posts all powerpoints online so you don't have to go to class.  I'm taking him for 201 next quarter

He's a really nice guy in person, but by far one of the worst teachers I have ever had. He spends the first 25 minutes of class rambling about useless nonsense and then spends the rest of the class confusing people with horrible examples and other irrelevant speeches. I only went to his lectures because my TA barely spoke english-- way to be OSU.

I found the class to be extremely easy!  I didn't buy the book and didn't go to more than a handful of classes and got an A.  Essay exams are the only grades.  Lectures I saw just read off the powerpoint... so I did the same and just slept in.  Good choice for an easy GEC.

Go to class, read the book, know the material. The prof is awesome but he expects you to do the work. Do the extra credit! It matters and makes a difference. Powerpoint is boring but Econ isn't a super exciting subject to anyone outside of Econ. It does change your perspective, it does help your life decisions.
Bruce is Cool! :D   if u can get the practice exams from ur TAs, it makes things so much easier :)

the lectures are realllly boring and he goes through the slides quickly- but he posts the powerpoint online so you dont have to go to class. the test questions are very in-depth and there are a lot of concepts (not just definitions to memorize), so you have to study alot to do well.

Bellner is a nice guy, but this is the most boring class ever.  All his notes are online, and he literally just reads straight fromt he slides.  It's an easy A, especially if you can get a practice exam from your TA.

I took 201 with Bellner because of the reviews on ratemyprofessor.  DON'T TAKE THIS GUY!  My roomates are in other 201 classes and they are 4x as easy.  Bellners Midterms are 75 questions each (in depth questions) and the other 201 professors give 25 question midterms that are MUCH easier.  During lecture all he does is read his powerpoints.
Awesome guy. Lectures are all online for econ 201.

Really nice all around guy but the lectures were verbatim from the reading and powerpoints that could easily have been found online.  If you get a practice exam for the class then it helps you a lot on his tests.

Bellner seems to be a nice guy but his lectures are extremely boring...my suggestion, dont go to lectures but do all of the reading then do your best to find a practice exam, also Myeconlab (online course guide) can be very helpful for studying for tests.
Fairly knowledgable and good at explaining concepts.  Friendly attitude.  I found his lectures very boring, though.
very good prof... very helpful

I loved professor bellner.  Read for the exams though, because he likes to talk about current events in class rather than textbook stuff- which is cool if you actually want to learn.  If you really aren't into econ- just read and skip class.  If you enjoy econ even a little, you'll love his class.

Lectures are really boring... He reads straight off the powerpoints... His exams for Econ 501.01 were not the easiest ive sat through... Gave a mix of multiple choice and essay questions... Though an easy grader (for the essay answers) and reaaaaly nice fellow.

He is a realllly nice guy.  I went to every single class the first half of the quarter and did really good. Second half of the quarter I didn't go at all and did the same. He reads straight off of the powerpoints.  Just read the book and take the online quizzes. EASY CLASS IF YOU JUST TAKE A LITTLE EXTRA TIME TO READ.
Easy exams, don't go to class EVER, just read the book.

Bellner is really nice. He tries to make the concepts easier to understand. His lectures are straight off the powerpoint online but make sure you read the chapter the night before you go to lecture, you will understand especially if you're not an econ type of person like me
He was a nice guy, and the class discussions were good, but the tests were based off the book not class. if you like econ go to class for the discussions, if not just read the book.
Very boring
very boring and tests were a little rough, no bonuses or anything

Didn't like the lectures too much. This guy is great, and quite funny.  He might repeat Murphy's Law, oh 100x or so--but you'll get used to it. (Thought he never taught prior at OSU-main campus.. but not sure)
I wasn't really happy with this teacher.  I just thought he know the material, yet he didn't communicate the subject enough. His tests were fair, however and easy.

Took 4700 + 4130 with Doetsch. Best Prof in Econ department. Very smart guy. Attendance for lectures is not required, but you won't mind showing up (also occasional EC). Lectures are engaging, good sense of humor and relates to current events. Graded on 4 exams which are tough, but not impossible if you show up and take notes. Lowest gets dropped.

His lectures and slides are engaging and he's funny; I actually looked forward to coming. There is never any homework, the whole grade is three midterms and a final where he drops the lowest test grade, which I liked. He also gives occasional extra credit just for coming to class. I loved his class and am taking his ethics class this semester!

Professor Doetsch makes the lectures engaging and informative. Exams are challenging but fair, focusing on critical thinking. The no-homework policy is a plus. Unstuck study was a lifesaver for exam prep along with the class materials. Definitely take this class if you can.

Prof. Doetsch was a very kind and caring teacher. It's abundantly clear that he loves what he teaches, but his exams are pretty difficult. They're a mix of T/F, MC, and short answer, and they're worded in kind of a tricky way. He'll randomly take attendance for extra credit, so it's good to show up if you need a grade boost.

Great guy -- does a good job relating content to current events. Does a good job reviewing fundamental econ, even though macro/micro is required for course. Extra credit for attendance. Cheat sheet for exams make them easy.

Dr. Doetsch is a uniquely engaging lecturer but his entire course was graded on 3 tests & nothing else. If you're a bad test taker, you're at a huge disadvantage. I found the test questions to be very subjective & overall the course was extremely unforgiving. The extra credit for attendance was nice but I still almost failed despite studying daily.

Dr. Doetsch is the best Econ professor -- everyone should take at least one of his classes! Very entertaining lecturer, and if you go to class and take notes, his tests are not super difficult. Plus, you will get extra credit just for showing up.

The whole class is 3 midterm exams plus a final (your grade is calculated based on your 3 highest). His lectures are engaging, though. Very understanding and willing to help if you don't understand the material. You do have to put in the work and pay attention--his exams are very tough.

He is passionate about econ and does his best to make a boring topic interesting. His exams are based on applying your econ knowledge. Lots of mindgaming with the short-answer section of exam. My criticism is that the majority of the practice questions is math but ~15% of the exam are math questions. So you're only preparing for 1 (small) section.
tough he is a interesting guy, i just want to tell you that the average grade for each midterm is around 71, it's even curved!!!!!

If you want to actually learn economics, there is no better professor. Dude brings so much energy and impeccable slides, tests are fantastically written. Not a class you can coast by in, but you'll learn valuable stuff by showing up. Easy to reach, hands down my favorite professor I've ever had. Taken 2 classes from him and would do so again.

Favorite professor at OSU. Doestch comes ready to teach every day and has a vibe similar to Dr. Cox in Scrubs. He occasionally got a little political for my liking but it wasn't a big deal. 3 exams, do well enough and drop the final, occasional extra credit for attendance. If you pay attention in class and think critically, exams are easy

Best ECON professor I had during my time at Ohio State. I highly recommend taking as many of his classes as you can. The class is graded by 4 exams but you get to drop the lowest of the 4. He also offers extra credit in the form of attendance periodically throughout the semester. Gave us a study guide, and let us use a cheat sheet for the exams.

Grade is based on 4 exams, with the lowest dropped. The lectures are super interesting, and Dr. Doetsch really knows what he's talking about. You can tell he's so passionate and knowledgeable about everything. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he takes extra credit for attendance randomly (did it 4x this semester). Loved this class and Dr. Doetsch!

Seeing a lot of reviews about difficult exams, and I have to disagree. He provides a study guide that covers the important takeaways from each topic, and allows a 1 page front/back cheat sheet. Questions were entirely formed from lecture material. Come to class and pay attention to the main ideas and you will have no problem. Dr. Doetsch is 10/10

I took him for 2 classes and I highly recommend it. Best lecturer I've had and is well-organized and informative. The class is exam heavy with 3 midterms and 1 final being the only graded components, but you can drop 1 exam. He offers extra credit randomly for attendance numerous times throughout the semester. Exams came solely from class material.

There is no howework which I loved, just extra credit for attending and 1 extra credit assignment. But 100% of your grade is decided by exams. Exams are hard so don't think you can just wing because he allows 1 cheat paper. Only thing that I didn't like is that he marks down so if you get 79.99% then your final grade will be a C+.

Great professor, exams are based around critical thinking. Your whole grade is determined by three exams. He always brings energy to class, and depends on class material for the exams. He's always willing to discuss any questions you have, and will be honest and thorough in his response. Seek out for him, he's one of the best at this university.

Very engaging professor. Easy to follow. Very knowledgeable and provides a variety of examples to explain the concepts. Answers questions clearly. Would definitely take as many of his classes as possible

Really interesting class if you are looking to learn more about labor markets, unions, and minimum wage laws. 4 exams in the course, and he drops your lowest one. Extra credit a few times throughout the semester for coming to class. Get to bring a sheet of notes for the exams. Exams are tough but doable, very much application based.

Only grades for the class were 3 exams worth 100 points each, best exam score was made out of 200 points for a total of 400 in the class. Up to about 30 points of extra credit when he randomly takes extra credit roll call or gives out extra credit assignments. Exams are easy since he allows a cheat sheet and has questions straight off the lectures.

This person is very stubborn, do not give you any opportunity to argue, online exam out of the score can not see the topic and the correct answer, direct registration score, really very bad. And this course is a variety of knowledge to put together the class, there is no sense.

This is one of the worst professors I have ever met at the Ohio State University. There are only three exams for the whole semester, but the questions are confusing. He posts the final grade immediately on your transcript, and you don't even have a chance to discuss the grade with him.

Lectures were fun and engaging. He made history unbelievably interesting. Graded only by the 4 exams (3 midterms + final), lowest score was dropped. Occasionally gave extra credit for attendance and an optional extra credit essay in the end.

Did not attend final, studied only the slides.  Learnt A LOT from the class. HE IS AMAZING, INTELLIGENT ETC
super engaging professor and makes dull topics interesting. not an easy a but if you go to lecture and review the notes exams are doable and open note. best professor at osu.

This course was conducted in-person, and while attendance was not mandatory, the attendance sheet would occasionally be passed around for extra credit. The course is graded on just three exams, with your highest exam score being counted twice. Dr. Doetsch is my favorite professor from the Department of Economics, and his quick wit makes class fun.

The entire grade is based off four exams, although one gets dropped. For the online class, they were fairly easy. Mostly multiple choice with one essay that was graded pretty leniently. The exams are open for a full day with no time limit so if you look hard enough you can find the MC answers in the lecture slides. Attend lectures for extra credit.

Good lectures, but the grade is really just based on the tests which can have a lot of "gotcha" questions. Double-edged sword of a class, but only 3 of the four tests are graded so you have some wiggle room.

If you go to his class, you will likely not have any issues. Extremely knowledgeable about what he teaches and is very approachable. Grades are based solely off of exams, but there is a extra credit assignment in addition to bonus points for random attendance. 4 exams, but you can drop the lowest. There is a clear path to a somewhat easy A

He is a nice person, the lectures were very serious. The only criterion for this class is exam scores. His test questions are difficult, you never know what he wants to test. Terrible exams, never wanna take his class again.

This professor is a good person but his exams were the worst. Read hundreds of pages and slides plus apply knowledge questions makes you feel unprepared for the exam the whole time. Not sure why people only focus on "he is nice" but the exams are the only graded items and RMP did trick me to believe his exams were not that bad. Worst class ever.

I took his in-person class this semester(disaster). He's funny and respected but you will be exhausted by his exams for sure. Reading hundreds of pages and hundreds of slides plus few hw questions is the only way to do well on the exam. Even though the exam is open note, questions were asking you to apply things that you won't be sure until graded.

Such an engaging professor especially considering that our class was completely online. The content for this class was pretty challenging but Professor Doetsch always did lots of example problems and was happy to answer all questions. Got extra credit for going to class and other opportunities. Take his class!

Dr. Doetsch is fun and probably has similar humor to your dad. He clearly knows his stuff. Your grade in this class mainly comes down to how you do on the three midterms and final (and he drops your lowest one). The tests themselves were fair. I never had to study for them, but since the class was online it was open note and we had 6 hours.

I respect Dr. Doetsch for his ability to lecture and keep students engaged. However the exams were just cruel. They make up the majority of your grade. You are given 6 long hours to take the exam, which consists of around 40 questions. You will use every minute of that because the questions are set up in a way to make you fail...
Dr. Doetsch is the best. He is very clear and teaches well, plus he is very funny. He can have some attitude sometimes but it could be much worse.
Kinda wack exams, but good lecturer and very engaging. If you review your notes you will do fine

Dr. Doetsch is a very good teacher and can keep lectures very interesting, even online. He is a tough grader and exams can be hard, but if you work hard the payoff will be well worth it and you can get a good grade. You will learn so much about econ from him, just know that it will be a little challenging. He wants everyone to do well and it shows!

Such a tough grader. I am a straight A student and have never struggled to understand econ, but had to attend tutoring twice a week just to make sure I would get all the points on the homework. He's a good teacher but talks very fast so be prepared. Read the textbook before lectures and you'll understand much better. Just be ready for the grading..
Dr. Doetsch is easily my best Econ professor so far. Assigns a book for the class, but his lectures are more important to the tests than reading from the book. Incredibly engaging - even online.

Dr Doetsch is a great lecturer and he knows how to make difficult material make sense. Homework and exam questions are pretty hard, but if you watch the lectures and put in the work, an A is very attainable. He gives you the basics of what you need to know and challenges you to really think about what youve learned and how to apply it. Great guy

He definitely makes the lectures engaging and doesn't just read off slides, so I really enjoyed them. However, the content is a little hard if you don't already have a strong background in Econ. I also found him a little intimidating to approach and gives off an indifferent/bored vibe when you ask questions outside class.

Love his class! His lecture is pretty fun and you can learn a lot. He is open to any kind of question and will answer it patiently. I would say his test is pretty fair, nothing that is too much but you do have to think before answer it. The grading is fair too. Overall, great professor for high level EC.

Pretty difficult course so be ready to put the hours in. I will say he is very funny and makes the class engaging as possible. He is very specific on his wording so you have to be careful to watch what he says. Overall a hard but nice class.
Good lecturer, tests are pretty easy. Wish there was more difficulty/rigor.
My favorite professor at OSU.
he's ok.
Dr. Doetsch is a good lecturer. He keeps people engaged and often had interesting discussions stemming from students' discussions. His tests definitely require preparation but it's nothing too crazy

Dr. Doetsch is the best professor I've ever had! His lectures were always super engaging and entertaining. I always understood his lectures really well and he writes almost everything by hand on the board so it's really easy to keep up. As long as you pay attention and understand your notes you will do well!

Great teacher, really good at walking you through the material and helping you understand. Definitely the best econ professor I've had and wouldn't mind taking any course with him. Bonus for showing up occasionally and exams aren't all that bad if you prep well.

Great dude. Lectures are actually interesting, keep you interested, and are often even fun. If you pay attention, youll get a good grade because hes so good at conveying the needed information youll just know it from class. Homework is graded really hard tho. If you are taking Econ, take ethans class!

Dr. Doestch is the best professor I've had. He's goofy, but he makes learning about economic history so interesting. He lectures using the chalkboard and usually doesn't provide notes/slide shows. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you better have someone to get notes from if you do miss. All grades are from exams. He's tough but certainly worth it.
tbh I won't get A if he did not give us extra credits and curve our exam. if you go to every lecture, you will receive extra credits and pass the class easily

My favorite professor I've had at Ohio State and it's not particularly close. All exams are open note, but you need to show up to class and take good notes to really do well on the exams. Very engaging lecturer who does a great job helping in office hours. A great instructor and a great dude, I would highly recommend Professor Doetsch to anyone.

Professor Doetsch is one of the best lecturers I've had at OSU. His micro econ class convinced me to add an econ minor, and he is the reason I took this class. His classes aren't easy, but he's a very fair grader and gives out bonus points for showing up on low attendance days. I would highly recommend for any econ student.

One of the hardest and pointless economics courses I've taken at osu. His lectures are confusing and boring. It is really difficult to undertand him. His questions on the exams are not clear and the grading doesn't make sense. The exams are open note but that doesn't help. I would not recommend this class or this professor.

I don't know why there are so many people here rate him well, obviously, his class is difficult and hard to understand. PPT doesn't include all things, and his notes are hard to see clearly. His lecture is boring and messy, many times you don't know what he is talking about and want to sleep. Exams are heavy, grade only depends on 3 exams.
Good teacher. All tests were open note

Hands down the best lecturer I have had at Ohio State. The class seemed like a boring topic, but somehow Prof Doetsch was able to make every single class extremely interesting. Entire class graded on 3 exams, and all material comes from lectures. You can use notes on exams, but they tend to be little help due to the length. Unbelievable professor.

Dr. Doetsch is an amazing professor. He shows how the materialism of Marx actually is applicable to economics problems of the past and present. Not to say he is a Marxist- he does not inject polarizing politics into his lectures. A testament to the power of data. He is invested in his students and it was a privilege to have him as a professor.

Dr. Doetsch is the best professor I've had at OSU so far. He made the class super interesting and engaging. He was always seeking student thoughts on the subject matter and tried to make the content as relevant as possible, providing numerous contemporary examples of economic issues. There are few powerpoints and most info is written on the board.

Professor Doetsch is awesome. You definitely have to go to every class, because the class is 4 exams and 10 online quizzes, all based solely on his lectures. He's hilarious and kind of quirky. Go to class and you'll be fine. Work hard and your grade will reflect that.

Dr. Doetsch is a fantastic professor. He has very engaging lectures and makes the class fun and interesting. His tests can be difficult, but they are not impossible. Overall, I would recommend taking a class with him.

Dr. Doetsch is a great professor and his lectures are always very interesting. His tests are pretty hard though, harder than you'd expect. Homeworks sometimes don't line up with what we did in class so I personally had to use the internet sometimes to figure things out. Overall, would recommend

This was a great class, but you definitely need a solid background in economics before you take it. You are graded on three exams and ten online quizzes, so it's a to come back from a rough start. You have to come to lecture, and during lecture, you need to take detailed notes. Exams require you to basically memorize all content.

Definitely the most entertaining professor I've ever had. Very enthusiastic and interesting lectures, and he obviously loves teaching and knows Economics well. Tests aren't a breeze, but are always very fair, and he tells you exactly what to study.

one of the best teachers i had at OSU. You can tell he enjoys what he does. He's a fair grader and allows everyone to improve their grades through extra credit. Come to class and take detailed notes or you won't pass. He lets you use your notes on exams, but don't be fooled you'll have to study harder. I took 4140, will be taking 4130 with him.
He is a great lecturer, but the grade is 100% depends on 3 big exams. Just trying to memorize all and you will be fine. Hard to get an A but easy to get a B.

If you take good notes (don't type them out) and show up to class, getting an A is completely doable. He gives several extra credit opportunities. The labor market report takes a ton of time but it's actually pretty fun to work on and his grading is very fair. Great class with probably one of the best professors in the department.

His lectures are fun and you'll learn a lot. However, the only grades you have are based on tests and on test days he is not your friend. In fact, his tests are so jammed-packed with questions that he makes it next to impossible to get to every question. He sets impossible standards for getting a half-way decent grade.

I will definitely take his class again. Dr. Ethan's class is hilarious and inspirational, taking his students to the edge of the knowledge. Even though his exams may require some readings, A is not hard to get if you really pay attention to what he says in lecture. Don't always blame professor as if not working hard is not your fault.

Best Econ professor I have ever had. I found his lectures pretty entertaining and despite the challenging exams I would definitely take again. Exams were open note but I recommend only using your notes as a last resort because you will not have enough time if you rely on them.

SB teacher. Super nan. Good lecturer, but the hardest test I have ever taken. The longest report I have ever written. I don't understand why he can be rated so high on this website. His lecture is good, but he doesn't write down a lot of notes. You have to read the whole book to prepare the test and the practice doesn't help at all.

Doetsch is a very knowledgeable professor. His classes are very inspirational and interesting, which make students concentrate. However, tests are hard, and the whole grade is counted on the three tests. No curve. If you screwed one test, getting an A is impossible. That's not cool.

I would recommend every student take a class with Dr. Doetsch. He is an economics professor but at least one of his courses does not have a pre-requisite (Econ 3048 - Ethics in Economics). He is fair in his policies but unwavering. You must earn your grade but it isn't hard to do so. I also had him for 4130 and 4140 previously.

Dr. Doestch is very passionate about Economics and this really shows. I enjoyed listening to his lectures, but the exams are rather challenging. I took this class hoping for an easy A, but that was not the case. If you are passionate about Economics or are able to dedicate a good amount of time to this course, take it. If not, take regular!

Doetsch is easily the best professor in the department. His lectures are easy to follow, engaging, and sometimes entertaining. If you show up and pay attention to lecture, you'll pass with flying colors. Take any class of his that you can.

Probably the best professor I have had yet at OSU! His lectures are great, easy to understand, and he makes all the material very interesting. He is a tough grader, but he posts study guides, and makes sure to review material. He is easy to understand, and structures the class in a very logical way.

I took Doetsch's freshman seminar about wage because it seemed interesting and I heard great things about him online. It was by far my favorite class, and he was my favorite professor in my first semester at OSU. He learns everyone's name, is very organized, and grades fairly. There is only one short assignment a week, perfect for a 1 credit hour.

He is so knowledgeable and passionate. This course is not so easy for me but I really enjoy it. I gained a lot from this course even though I can hardly get an A. We love him so much! Some students even choose his other courses for they like him so much. Easy A if you can follow him during the lectures. No homework.
Gives any and all the information you'll need for the exams in lecture, with many many examples for each type of problem. Very helpful and responds quickly to emails.
Doetsch is very fair

Dr. Doetsch is the best lecturer I have had so far. He is really good at explaining textbook jargon by using easy to understand examples. The class was graded only on exams, but the lowest score was dropped so you could afford to have one slip-up. On low attendance days, he would give out extra credit, so come to every lecture!

Dr. Doetsch is great! His classes can be difficult but rewarding. You will certainly learn a lot. If you come to class, take notes, and participate in some discussions you will do fine. When I took the course, the tests were completely essay but graded on a rubric to see if you included key material to gain more objectivity.

Dr. Doetsch is very knowledgeable & I learned a lot from his lectures. His tangents are both informative & entertaining. He moved very fast in lectures due to time constraints, so stay awake and write quickly to keep up. 3 exams & 10 homework assignments make up the final grade. Rarely gives out extra credit, but when he does it's 1 point.

Great lecturer who always provides intriguing arguments with evidence for and against scholars' papers. There's 3 open note exams and no other grades so you really have to do well on them to get an A which can be a problem. If you simply go to every class and pay attention, you will do really well

No homework. No projects. Only thing graded in the class our three exams. He takes your best exam score out of the three and puts it in a second time to help your grade. Offers random extra credit points for showing up to class. Interesting lectures and genuinely interested in teaching students. All exams are open note and if you go you will pass.

Proffesor Doetsch is hilarious, and teaches a lot because of it. Don't worry though, his class was such that if you payed attention during the lecture you simply had to regurgitate it to get an A, there wasn't much thought involved. But you still learn a lot.

If you have the option of taking Dr. Doetsch's class, do it. He's a great lecturer and conveys material in a clear way. I had him for ECON 3048 and the class was both relatively easy and interesting. If you go to class and take good notes you'll be golden because all his exams are open note.

Great lecturer who makes class enjoyable. Very smart man and passionate about what he teaches. Assigns a fair amount of reading, but everything you need to know is in the lectures. Go to class, take detailed notes, and the exams won't be a problem.

In retrospect, this class was really easy. His three tests are all open note so all you have to do is go to class everyday and take diligent notes; write down everything he says. Briefly read over your notes the night before exams and refer back to them as needed. Not only easy, but extremely interesting. Go to class to get those extra cred points!

I recommend taking class with this professor. He is energetic, smart and hilarious. He is well prepared and is willing to help. If you attend his lectures and take notes, you will get at least a B, if not A. I was intimidated ny some negative comments about him before taking the class but I got an A-, so all you have to do is work hard.

I've taken 2367, 4130, and 4140 from this guy, and they all were awesome.  Best lecturer I've had at OSU.  If you are good at essay type exams this is the class for you!
