Aubhik is pretty funny, but he teaches the non-calculus based section with a lot of calculus. You'd be better off taking this course with a different teacher.

You take 5 quizzes, but only the best 3 count. There is one midterm and a cumulative final. He posts homework online, but it is not for a grade. You have to attend lecture to understand the concepts. The quizzes and tests are all based off the optional homework. I would recommend taking this class with him; I heard other professors make it hard.

Really good lecturer and made micro pretty easy. Didn't cover much material though, only about half of the syllabus. 2 midterms and a final, all pretty easy. 5 quizzes, best 3 count. as he gives hints for exams. Don't need book other then to check info from lecture. DO THE HOMEWORK and the derivations he covers, all exam questions come from these.

Good guy, easy class. Kind of a joke though. I had him for micro, and you can tell he's a macro prof. Do the homework sets and understand them and you'll get an a, the tests are based off the homework not anything he says in class

Aubhik is a very entertaining professor. He's very funny and is always making jokes that make lecture enjoyable. He doesnt cover everything he sayshe is going to because he spends weeks on each chapter. But he makes it clear what he expects for his homework sets and exams. Overall he is a good professor and its not hard to get a decent grade

Mike was an amazing professor for ECON 4001! All of his lectures were very clearly laid out and if I ever had any questions, he made sure to make himself available to discuss them. His exams are very fair, and even allowed us to bring study "cheat sheets" to the exams as well. I wish he also taught ECON 4002 so I could take that with him as well!

One of the worst ones here at OSU. Lecture slides were very confusing and I had to teach all the material to myself. He can come off aggressive in office hours, which made me a little nervous to ask him anything which didn't help at all. His weighting of the class is also unfair.

Unfair weighting of class. Exams are basically worth our entire grade. Very bad at explaining concepts and I basically had to learn all the content myself. He means well, but he sometimes can come off in a passive aggressive manner.

Professor Ye was helpful for the most part. His lecture notes were well organized but his lectures were more restatements rather than new, thought provoking ideas. His true or false on the exams are extremely difficult while the math is fairly simple. Very nice person to interact with should you choose to go to office hours.

Very smart, nice guy. Lectures were interesting but rarely focused on material we'd actually be tested on, you have to work through examples independently to learn anything. Exams were hard (60% avg), little impact from HW + attendance but the class had a heavy curve. Not bad for a weed out class but get ready to put in work

Class is extremely hard, not because the content is particularly difficult (students with other professors seem to find this class easy), but he doesnt show any of his work on the notes and you have to reverse engineer all of his solutions. Doesnt review concepts at all.

A lot of the material on the exams were not even covered in class. The class lectures were just him reading off the board and the powerpoint. He really never explained anything and he made this class so difficult. The averages for our midterm was 50% and overall, he just made the class too hard.

Honestly, I'm not sure why he makes the Econ 4001 harder than the other professors. He would give us 100% on the homework and then when we followed a similar format on the exam, we'd get a 0 on it. Given, he does curve the class by a considerable amount, but he doesn't explain his notes well enough.

Very organized, clear, and down-to-earth. Followed the book closely, so we didn't have to take notes, but could concentrate on understanding the material during lectures. Often punctuated the lecture with interesting, relevant new  research, and the occasional sharp question.
Very fair professor.  The tests aren't anything you haven't covered.  Do the work and you will be fine.  Very helpful at office hours or after class

I took 501.02, and I have to agree with the engineering major who posted on 6/11/10. This class isn't hard unless you are looking for the material to be spoonfed. Study your homework assignments and make sure to understand every concept on the slides. If you do that, there is no reason why you can't get at least a B+ or A-.

Tough class, you will have to teach yourself a lot, Prof. Ye is very willing to help students and really tries, but he is not good at conveying the information to the students if you have to take 501.02 theres a good chance you will have him and best I can say is study the book and attend class because he gives points for attendance

as an engineer i'm used to having unclear, undecipherable lectures and teaching myself the material. this class was easy compared to my others, ppl are just ****in about not being spoonfed the material.

A nice guy who genuinely wants his students to do well, but Prof. Ye really isn't very good at imparting concepts. The material wasn't particularly difficult, but the lecture style causes a lot of people to struggle. If you're a decent student you shouldn't have much trouble. Otherwise, you may want to think twice about this one.

Took 501.02, I got a B. I bought the book and taught myself mostly. I went to the TA every single week for an hour. Lixin is the WORST TEACHER EVER.  He made the class a lot harder than it needed to be. Crazy questions on the exams. Didn't learn much. I would change majors so I never had to have him again!
interesting but hard

Highly recommended if you are looking for an excuse to kill yourself.  You can't understand anything the man says.  There is one midterm and one final exam, both impossible, never have an average over 50%.  The material isn't even that hard... he just makes this class so much harder than it needs to be.  Makes you feel stupid, even if you have a4.0

his accent is very thick and it's hard to understand him sometimes. soft spoken, so sit in the front couple rows if you want to hear anything. midterm was hard as hell, final wasn't that bad. VERY generous with the final grades, so don't sweat the hws and mid that much. exs come straight from the book. don't rush through the hw, understand them

Professor Li knows his stuff well, but simply does not know how to impart it to students. Half the class is asleep. Lecture's boring as hell, slept a lot in class. Finals and mids slightly difficult.6 assignments for the quarter. Reads from the slide. Gives no examples outside of textbook, not even to explain a concept. Stay away.

This is a difficult class, but it isn't impossible to get a good grade. Keep up with the book, notes, and go to class. Understanding the HW is really important. He is a nice guy and the lectures are fairly clear if you understand what is going on. Exams are similar to HW, though a little more difficult. He and the TA are usually willing to help.

Nice guy but his class is hard to understand and very boring.  Overall if you do the homework you will do well in the exams and the class shouldn´t be to hard. Also he gives a lot of opportunities to improve if you do not do well in the first half of the class.
Very soft voice, pretty tough grader but did teach the material fairly well. Would see who else was teaching the course but wouldnt say to absolutely stay away from him

Good professor! Sit up front to hear well because he has a soft voice.  Very good at explaining things in more than one way so that everyone can understand.  Problem Sets about every other week.  Semi-difficult exams.  Overall good prof and class.
No Comments
No Comments

Audrey Light is straight up poverty. Hours upon hours of mind numbing lecture videos and problem sets that have nothing to do with the exams. She might as well write the exams in a different language. I don't know who hurt her, but someone did and she wants to take that out on her students by making their lives as miserable as possible. The worst.

Rudest person I've ever met inside or outside of a classroom. She seems extremely unhappy and to genuinely hate people. I actually feel sorry for her in that she's so unhappy. I blame the university for accepting tuition money from students and subjecting them to a woman who obviously needs professional psychiatric help.

I do not know how Light is still a professor at this university. I have never left a RMP review before but she, even though I took this online asynchronously, still managed to be the worst professor I have ever had. Rude in emails + impossible midterm and final. The quizzes she gives are NOTHING like the exams. Please take a different professor.

I’m currently taking her course and was expected to “skip” the midterm because of health issues explained to her. She said there is no extension or makeup allowed, instead I’m expected to take the final which would count for 80% of my grade and cover the midterm and final exam. never experienced this with a professor before.

Very tough Professor, made me hate economics. So much so that I changed my major. She should not be allowed to be teaching. Does not help you at all, exams are ridiculously though. Does not post PowerPoint because "it does not help", rather makes us watch 1 hour long video. Videos where you are on the verge to fall asleep. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!!!

Took ECON 4001.01 asynchronously with Professor Light. I read the textbook and took notes, but didn't watch any of the lectures. The midterm average was around a 60%, but I personally found it straightforward. Would probably be a lot harder if it wasn't all multiple choice! Grade was determined by 10 quizzes, a midterm, and the final (50%).

No friggin clue how in the world I got a B. Sooo hard! Other profs teach the same class and its fine. Her class is dreadful. She wants you to buy the textbook which doesn't help at all. She doesn't teach ANYTHING and is sinfully boring. I learned absolutely nothing because she just talks and talks and talks while the only grades are exams.

Throughout my time at OSU, never left a single review. But after her class, I felt like I owed an honest review. I have always been a 3.7/3.8 student and a LOVER of econ. Her class made me hate econ. Her class & exams are ridiculously tough so one advice: DON'T TAKE HER CLASS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE, you & your GPA will regret it. Just like I am rn.

Professor light was one of the rudest professors Ive ever had. Most of the class had failed the midterm and the final. Throughout the semester she would send emails with very derogatory comments to her students. She was not in any way motivating or welcoming to her students. This class made me second guess pursuing economics.
why are all other professors for this course simple and she is terribly hard

For accounting, econ 4001.01 is a requirement. I saw the class listed as online and was like "cool, least I don't gotta go to Columbus." But Light says: Nah bro, you go to Columbus to take the exams!". I took a quick look at all the practice exams and they are really hard. She says quizzes aren't gonna be on exams as well. Just horrible and pitiful

Exams were impossible. Avoid at all costs if you can. She tells you the exams will structurally look like the practice exams, which they did, but maybe one or two questions were carried over from previous practice exams, so be ready for curveballs on the exam. Impossible course to get an A in.

This class was by far the most difficult course I've taken at OSU. Prof. Light was extremely unhelpful and disrespectful to her students. Instead of offering help to struggling students, she  blamed them for doing poorly and not being prepared enough. Her entire class rides on a few grades. My only hope is that she will read this and reevaluate.

Dont take this class. She is an awful professor that builds her ego creating overly complicated lectures and tests. She belittles her students over email in a very unappealing manner. She also puts 80% of the grade into 25 MC and 7 short answer which means each wrong answer is a critical hit to the your grade.

So many people gave Audrey such a bad review but in all honesty, she's not that bad. It's true that her video lectures are boring and the tests are quite challenging, but she lays everything out clearly and if you do the problem sets and study Q's then you should be fine. Also, there is a curve!

By far the worst teacher and hardest class I've taken at OSU. Online lectures are tediously boring with her monotone voice. Expects you to memorize 7 chapters of detailed information for exams. No formula sheet on exams. Grades unnecessarily hard on the open-ended questions on exams. Should not be teaching at a respected university.

Out of everything she could have done to make an economics class more relevant to her students, she chose to record herself in the banalest and uninterested monotone. You see this attitude when you talk to her and in her exams too. Poorly structured and lack of instructions. If you're not interested, do us both a favor and don't teach.

This is a very difficult class. The midterm was different from the problem sets and study questions we were given. When sending the email about the  midterm grades, she made it apparent that she will not be giving a curve at all. I would not recommend taking this class at all.

Audrey has to be the absolute worst economics professor I have ever had. Never have I encountered a professor so ridged and difficult. The midterm mean score pathetically hovered around a D. When posting grades, she clearly stated that no curve was to be allocated and to just drop the course if you did poorly. Simply put, this class is ridiculous.
Very very tough class, exam is nothing like the practice problems or weekly quizzes!!! Do not recommend taking her course, avoid her at all costs

She is the worst professor I have ever seen. Lectures are stupid and long but has no connection with exams. The average for the first midterm was only 68%. If you are going to take Econ 4001 don't choose her!!!!
Just awful. Won't take hers if I could choose again. Worst decision ever.

Have to say this class will give me the one and only B that I will ever get and drag down my GPA. I can't see why it is not because of the teacher or the way she teaches. Extremely LONG online lectures that dull you to death, not helpful at all practice problems and negative attitudes, I am just speechless regarding this class.

Awful. Worst professor I've ever had. Most people failed the first midterm. When asked for extra practice problems she said she didn't have time to upload any. Extremely belittling toward her students. Refuses to do anything to help. Do not take. She does not deserve to be a professor at this university.
awful

Class starts slowly, but gets better as it goes. She is genuinely interested and has no problem with debate during the lesson. No essays, two midterms, 6 problem sets of moderate difficulty.  You will learn econ, and it could be a lot worse!

Dr. Brown is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. She is very good at this field and so patient and kind in and out of the class. If you do all the homework, you will be fine. There's a group presentation at the end of the semester. Please consider choosing her class, especially if you are an economics major.

Bill White is an excellent professor, while attendance is not mandatory he does occasionally call on students during the lecture which goes into an attendance grade. Overall he is a great lecturer who uses many real life relatable examples. Going to office hours helps a lot.

Very strong lecturer, makes it very attributable to future careers. Had open note exams until the final after he caught people cheating and made it closed note, understandable. Mix of econ people and glenn people, this class is easy for econ and probably more challenging for PPE. An interesting and applicable class
Interesting lectures with lots of examples. Concepts were explained clearly, exams were fair and not much homework. He cares a lot about his students.

Professor White is truly the best professor I've had for any Econ courses.  The man brings passion to his class every time he lectures, and he makes what would be mundane material very engaging and interesting.  I highly encourage taking his classes.

Econ is hard regardless of the instructor, but he was very willing to help and spend significant class time answering our questions. He let us have notes on the exams and pop quizzes. He was funny and real with us, and also very available during office hours to clarify material.

Best professor in the whole department by far. Explains boring concepts so well, and is always willing to talk out any questions you may have. Grades by participation, and end grade is curved by that participation. Couple of quizzes and homeworks, and three exams. Overall, a great guy and put in some effort in the class and an A is guaranteed.

If you are looking for an easy ECON course, take one with Bill White. His lectures are interesting, and he explains concepts very well. He doesn't require in depth economic principles or mathematics. He covers the basics very well and its very clear and easy to understand. He gives very generous curves, anyone who tried gets an A or B. Take him!

Great teacher, explains difficult topics really well. Randomly calls on students in class for attendance which is kinda beat but lectures aren't terribly boring. He's also pretty sarcastic which can be fun

Great professor, taught me all I need to know about basic economics. Very easygoing and fun person, he made lectures interesting if you attended. I did say that the class requires a textbook, but all it needs is Freakonomics, which is easy to find online!

Intro to economics with Bill White was incredibly easy. The material is not very stimulating, but White is a very nice guy and an easy grader. I didn't turn in the first homework (out of 100 points) and I still finished the class with a 95%. Once you get to the essay assignments, you practically get 100% for answering the question.

His grade evaluation was very unfair. At the same time, he randomly grouped the class, if you have good teammates, you can get an A without studying. But my teammates were not that good, resulting in such a low score. He never listens to your explanations

Bill is the real deal. He knows his stuff with real world experience and cares about his students doing well. He gives a generous amount of extra credit with pop quizzes being extra 5% plus a curve at the end. He is very helpful when you ask questions, and as long as you actually go to class and do the reading it's not too hard at all.
85% of the grade was 3 tests and all of those tests were impossible. the lectures are hard to sit through but he does actually care about what hes doing

Professor White's Underground Economy class is not particularly difficult. All that he asks is that you participate twice in class discussions, and attend the presentations. The pacing is a little fast at first, but once you get the presentations, it's a cake walk. And if you like writing, then it's even easier.

Dr. Whites lectures are not very stimulating, but he does talk fast and shares fun stories. Overall, hes a good guy and will help and encourage you. The final was worth 30% of the grade and the midterms worth 20% each. The final research paper was 10% of the grade, so the homeworks dont really help your grade. You will get an A or B in this clas

BILL! An absolute legend. Teaches by real-world example, not hypotheticals. Lectures can drag on a bit but if you zone out for a hot sec, you won't miss much. Very sweet man who is willing to help and happy to answer questions. Didn't read the book much except for exams! Had two online midterms and one online final, easy A if you pay attention.

I had professor White for underground Econ and let me tell you do not ever take this class with Bill White. Almost the entire course is based off of group projects so if you have a bad group you're screwed because you're with the same group the whole semester. Bill is a tough and borderline unfair grader I would avoid this guy at all costs.v

Coming from Dr Hartman's micro econ to Dr White's macro econ was a big switch. It's a lot different and tougher. Dr White's lectures are boring, but they are essential to understanding material. You will need to review those before every test, they're on Carmen. His tests were relatively difficult in my opinion, but you can pull a B if you study.

Honestly one of the best professors I've had. He explains the material very well and gives tonnnns of extra credit. If you get an 88 or higher you get an A. Everything was reasonable for the midterms, however, the final screwed me over and took my grade to a B so beware of that.
Very nice instructor

Bill was accessible and gave excellent lectures. He was attentive and respectful of every students lectures, even the questions asked by the brain-dead fisher crowd.   Class is entirely optional but pop-quizes are a great way to get extra credit.

His lectures can get boring, but being there in class really helps you out on the tests. He does post all the lecture notes online. There are pop quizzes beware!  Although the material might not necessarily be interesting, his passion and interest in the topic is enough to keep me going. He is a good guy!

Professor Dadzie was a good professor! Showing up to class is necessary as he never really used Canvas much, but the layout of the class was simple. Most grades were from quizzes and exams but he literally goes over the exact answers in class and answered questions generously. He also always emailed me back quickly too.

I've had Dadzie for a lot of classes within the EEDS major. As long as you pay attention and do the work, his grading is valid. Make sure you pay attention during lecture, and if you have questions- ask. He is willing to explain and often gives you the main points you need to know before any exam. Just show up to class and you should be fine!

A pretty basic subject was turned impossible by Dadzie. The "quizzes" were essentially midterms, so prepare hard for them. He is impossible to work with, unorganized, didn't use Carmen, and one of the worst professors I've ever had. I hope they get some new professors to teach his material because he was the only prof available for this class.

Cool professor, really knows his stuff & tried to make the class engaging. The lectures were boring, but it was more-so because of the material. Quizzes were pretty easy, some pop quizzes counted as extra credit. The group project/debate were okay. Overall, really nice guy; the class was not too hard, just boring. Don't bother buying the textbook

Puabli's lectures can be interesting and engaging. Part of her grading system can be a little unfavorable to the student, especially with the quizzes you have to take. Her grading on assignments is inconsistent and is returned in an untimely manner. Overall, the class was somewhat interesting but if you can take a different elective, you should.

I had Pubali as a recitation instructor, but she was so amazing she deserves a review! She explains concepts perfectly and has no issue slowing down to explain basics from the ground up. Pubali is a wonderful teacher!

I wrote a review when I took him last year when I looked back when rating my professors this year it had vanished. I have a feeling he reported it but I can't see why it was taken down because it's not like I said anything bad. The final grade is determined by 3 exams which do not look anything like what you learn in class.
Great professor, provides the notes, interesting lectures, straight forward exams. Always willing to help his students, even provides review for every exam.
One of the better instructors at Ohio State.  I recommend taking any of his classes.

Kerry is very helpful and more than willing to re-explain topics if needed; however, he usually has very short and direct slides that don't require much explanation.  This is my second class with him and both were easy as long as you just pay attention and read the slides.  No need for many notes. Highly recommend taking.

Class was Cake.  No textbook. lecture slides were online.  Everything came from that so really no need to go to class, except it is attendance based, which is the only bad part.  Really into what he does, explains stuff great, approachable, laid back really a good teacher.  Next quarter he is teaching Sport Economics then he is done teaching at OSU

Kerry is a very knowledgeable and likable teacher. If you go to class and study for the midterms his class is very manageable. He is quick to respond to student emails and has a casual yet informative learning environment. One of the best teachers I have had at OSU
3 Midterms, 3 one page papers, and attendance. I could have got an A, but I missed too many classes. The material was interesting and easy to comprehend. Kerry is a nice guy, very like-able.

The class is extremely easy, but Kerry is useless. Reads word-for-word the slides made by the textbook company for two hours each class. Bring a laptop, ipod, or pillow, you will need it. Ps he is NOT hot at all.

Kerry is a very good teacher. He tries to to relate all of the material to real life examples. Class does not involve a lot of out of class time. You have weekly homework assignments that take around 30 min to an hour. You only have one midterm and one final which is basically a midterm because it only covers second half of class. Take his class!
sooo helpful
He is OK, the only problem is that he gets lost sometimes.His exams are kind of harder than expected.Overall he is a good teacher.

Although I never went to class bc I found this stuff quite easy, Tan is a great teacher. He tries to make modern examples to help people understand economic theories. If you can understand economics and do the work, this class is a breeze just bc the professor is so good and so helpful. Very accessible via email.

Not being an econ major, I found this class rather difficult. I never went to class b/c it consisted of reading off of the powerpoint. The movie shown was on Google Video, so I didn't go to that either. Alot of cramming went into this class & I didn't learn much. Kerry is very resourceful and always helped if I needed it.
Taught from the book/slides that he posts on the web. Attendance def not mandatory. Kerry is very accessible via email, always replied back with answer usually within minutes.

Kerry is a good teacher. He is a grad-student, so he understands what it's like to still be in school (unlike some other professors I've had). 584 is a sweet class, and is def. not difficult. 3 exams and in class "quizzes" which area attendance grades. Great Class, and cool teacher.

Great Teacher.  He was a second year grad student when I had him and it was his first quarter teaching a course and it was an upper level course.  He did confuse himself from time to time but other than that he did a great job.

Kerry is the best TA for Econ that you will ever have.  A great guy, very funny and easy to understand. He makes the pretty boring subject of economics interesting and not too hard.  He will go out of his way to help you and if you email him with a question he will reply literally within 10 or 15 minutes.  I hope he will get to teach soon.

Kerry is a TA, however, he is better at teaching than some Econ teachers.  He is easy to understand, makes the quite boring and difficult subject of Economics a lot of fun.  He uses real life easy examples and helps you as much as he can.  You can email him with a question and he will respond in about 10 minutes.  Basically the best Econ TA.
Take this class with another professor. Worst class of my life.

Never talked about anything relevant to the class. Often talked of alcohol, drugs, partying, sex, and China??? Often made remarks to foreign TA that were not appropriate at all. He clearly had tenure and could not care less about his students actually learning anything.

TAKE REGULAR ECON, NOT AED. Openly bashed students who have testing accommodations (SLDS). Goes on weird tangents during class. Every exam was pushed back bc he was so behind. Racist towards our asian TA. One day he just didn't show up bc he forgot. Don't bother buying the textbook. This is a "teach it yourself"

Mark is horrible. Racist and chauvinistic comments made to TA and in general. Does not accommodate for SLDS students, and makes snide comments about them. Is late to class consistently. As an SLDS student myself, he refused to accommodate me in a time of need, and told me I would probably fail his class. An awful human that should be fired.

This professor went on tangents, sometimes completely unrelated to class. He does not accommodate students, particularly with SLDS. Be prepared to not only find other sources to teach you, but sit through problematic rants if you attend lecture for the random bonus quizzes.
Hilarious professor decently entertaining when he said things that only tenured professors can say

One of the worst lecturers on campus. He goes off on erronious rants constantly and moves through basic economic definitions at a turtles pace. Makes up for having pretty straightforward exams as well as in class extra credit participation points. The class is 95% exam based with one drop over 4 exams. Overall not a bad class just prof is not good.

Mark is such a good professor. If you pay attention during lectures you can get a guaranteed B or C. Attendance isnt mandatory but he offers a lot of bonus points during class, so its an incentive to go. I really like his lectures and he helped me in other ECON classes. Amazing guy and professor!

He made no changes to his syllabus to reflect COVID-19 and the hardships that come with it. 95% of your grade is exams, during a pandemic, mental health, and financial crisis. Was not very accomodating and rambles so it is hard to follow him as he teaches. This is a course you definitely teach yourself.

Bonus quizzes offered in class, so attendance is not required, but does help your grade. Take 4 exams (including final) and drop the lowest so it is a pretty easy A. He also clearly loves teaching and tries to have fun with it so that makes econ a little less awful
This guy managed to make what should have been a boring class very interesting. Attendance points count as extra credit on tests and you get to drop one exam grade. He's also hilarious.

I found his lectures to be very boring and hard to sit through for 80 minutes. It could just be economics but he also wasn't very engaging. He did give bonus points pretty much every week so I never skipped a lecture because then I didn't have to worry about the midterms. I ended up with a 108% as my final grade.
Excellent professor, he know's what he's talking about and does a great job of conveying that information to students.

Econ definitely isn't my thing, but Partridge wasn't a bad teacher. He allows bonus quizzes almost every lecture which he'll add to the exam. His class was a challenge for me and ended up with a B-, but half of that is because I had to miss one of the exams, and had to take the final which there isn't as much bonus for the final

Mark is AWESOME! He seriously is one of the sweetest professors I've ever had, and I love the way he teaches economics. Very understandable and relatable. Even friends who had him from semesters ago rave about him. Tests and homework aren't easy, but bonus quizzes should help make for an easy A in the class if you attend lecture and try.

If you take this AEDECON 531, be prepared to work your butt off. You HAVE to read the book & you should have some background in Economics; I didn't & I struggled. There are only 3 homework assignments, but they are hard. The midterm is all essay and the final is take-home, but 25 LONG essays. Class was boring and long, and he just read the slides.
Enjoyable conversational style lectures. Very interesting and applicable topics. Reccommended.

Mark is a great teacher. He has a Canadian accent and is always making up jokes. Attendance is not mandatory but he gives bonus points for attending.  His tests are tough but he usually curves it so most people have A's. He's not bad to look at either!

Economics isnt my thing but with this guy I went to class every day. He's crazy and really fun to listen to and the guy definetly loves his job. He reviews the previous days material at the beginning of class and explains thing very thoroughly! Take this class if you want an easy A and an interesting time!

Professor Kim is a PhD student who has very long and meaningless lectures. Although there is a curve in this class, he does not post each exam grade until the end of the semester. In the syllabus, he claims that your grade on Carmen "does not matter" and is all based on "relative assessment." Try to avoid this TA as much as possible.

Mr. Kim is a PhD candidate and was kind, but I took int. macro with him and would not suggest it. Class wasn't difficult, but the lectures were not engaging/sparking discussion. Extra credit was given to make up for horrific midterm scores. An easy A in the end but constant mistakes on homeworks got old fast and email responses were infrequent

A good guy at heart, but just cannot teach to save his life. 

You'd be better off just reading the textbook and not coming to class because all he does is write the definitions on the board and talk in circles. Asks weird and vague questions both in class and on his exams. Stay away if you want to learn the material and don't want a headache.

Prof. Negrete is a good guy and means well. That being said, bro could not teach a dog to sit. I've taken Econ in the past and had a pretty good grasp of the material, but the way Negrete teaches it makes it so confusing, and he asks weird, ambiguous questions. Impossible exams, hard to understand, etc... Would not recommend

Worst professor I have ever had. I did not learn anything from his lectures. Just read the textbook. Extremely inconsistent in grading and completely unclear criteria. Easy class, easy homework but you don't learn anything. Somewhat of a nice guy personally, but DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

He knows what he's talking about but cannot teach it. Obviously very passionate and a kind guy, but cannot convey the information to students who haven't interacted with economics before. Only take his class if you either NEED to or are great at economics already.

Don't take this class if you don't like reading and watching videos. He has a project due in the beginning of the third week class, which requires about a hundred pages reading. He plays videos during the lecture which is meaningless and boring.
Professor Garcia is just a genuinely nice person. It really warms my heart that he really sees us as individuals and how he always reminded us that grades dont define us as human beings.

The worst professor I have ever had. He has an accent. Prepared to study all the things by yourself after class. He was not sure about the things he talked about, either, such as the quizzes.. Attendance is mandatory. You cannot skip class, even just one class.

His accent always makes me feel confused and he makes wrong on the answers of some exam or quiz. Some questions of exams aren't related to any of the material he teaches if you want to get A on 4002.02, ignore his class.

I liked Mario's class! Very intellectually stimulating and definitely a tough class to teach but he tries his best to put it in words that OSU students can understand. If you work hard and come to class its an easy A and he specifically says this multiple times throughout the semester. Just make sure not to get cocky

Mario was my TA for economics. I think hes a graduate student. He has an accent but hes understandable. Hes very willing to allow makeup quizzes and cares about students. He was knowledgeable and prepared very thorough review sessions. I would take him again.

Very lucky to get her as my Econ51 prof! All things are take-home so mentor sessions helped. She has online lectures (content) we watch at home and then come to class to discuss more on them, do practice problems, etc. which I found was very time-efficient and helpful. She's straightforward during office hours. Cares about her students!

Professor Goel is hands down one of the most inspiring professors I have ever had during my time at Pomona. She loves her students and clearly is passionate about their growth and learning, both inside and outside of the classroom. Super comprehensive lectures, fair grader. You will learn a lot.

She is the best! The amount of effort and concern she shows for her students is unreal. She makes classes engaging and fun and will make you think critically about everything you've heard in the media about trade. This is a great class that combines theoretical models + reading empirical work and writing a research paper in the end. Recommended!
Great professor!
Professor Goel was very straight up about what she expected from students and what she expected was very reasonable. She also has quite a sense of humor and loves interacting with students.
She is a great Econ Professor! Definitely take her for an intro course at Pomona

Shouldn't be teaching. Wasted half the class worrying if the class was learning as well as they could and brought in people to evaluate her teaching skill with the students.  Just plain annoying; do not take this class if you want any motivation to go to lecture every day.
She's a nice TA who's willing to help, but sometimes confuses herself to the point she gives us a wrong answer and has to be corrected. Also, needs to speak up.

He is an amazing teacher. There is no doubt he knows the topic very well. His lectures are clear and he gives many detailed (and funny) examples for otherwise difficult topics. The homework and exams are very fair, and he prepares students well with practice exams and questions. I really enjoyed class and believe he is a wonderful option for 2001.

One of the best professors in the department! His lectures are super methodical and easy to follow and shows every step to make sure you understand everything. Homework is few and far between and not too difficult if you go to classes. Exams are only half of your grade and allow open notes. Highly recommend over any other intermediate professors

Attendance isn't "mandatory," but he gives pop quizzes to motivate people to come. His lectures are very clear and he knows the material well. 4 tough homework assignments, and 4 Exams, with averages ranging from 40-70. His exams really make you think deeply about the material, but he does give very generous curves to reward you for your efforts.

Clear lectures but exams were very difficult and short. Homework material did not relate much to the exams. Professor seemed more interested in his research than teaching. Only had one office hour a week and missed 5 classes without getting a substitute. Large curve.
Great professor, clear lectures. Exams are difficult, but there is a generous curve. Recommended for BS Econ majors.
good!
No Comments

Possibly the worst professor I've had in my four years at OSU. He has no idea how to teach the subject material. Lectures have little relevance to homework and exams. Youtube will be your best friend in this class.

Her powerpoints are very informative and clear and explain all the concepts well which was extremely helpful. The two midterms were fairly easy; both were very similar to the problem sets and the practice exams that she puts out. If you understand all the material and do the problem sets/practice exams, getting an A should be pretty easy.

She's a young PhD student who wants her students to do well. Always willing to entertain discussion and unpopular opinions. The class is super easy, with one paper per week relating to the economic topic of the week. One final paper and a presentation on the paper. Hope she teaches more classes in the future.

I'm not the type to waste my time writing about a professor so i'm literally here to like you to please take a different professor for this class or if you can avoid this class do at all cost. One final project , 2 midterms. He literally doesn't prepare you for any of the exam and my class had an average under 50% on midterms.

Class: Macro Econ
- hard for no reason
- very confusing 
- makes his own test
- homework doesnt help, and the teachers had control over which program to pick for the students, the system he picked is not helpful at all
- overall 2/5

Solid professor. The discussions are not the most engaging but he tries his best to teach us the important Economic principles. The papers were easy. The readings were a bit long but they aren't mandatory

Course grade is decided by 3 essays, participation, and weekly free writes & grammar exercises which is kinda just filler to make sure you come to class. 2 of the weekly assignments can be dropped. The lecture is kinda dry and dull, sometimes he gets upset if no one answers the questions he asks the class. A bit nitpicky with essay grading.
HORRIBLE. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. Exams were horrid, but there is no final. I would personally recommend another teacher for this course. Did not learn a single thing. Waste of Money.

She isn't too bad, but I can't recommend her to someone else. She's seems nice, but she's inaccessible outside lectures. She does offer accommodations, and she's fair. But quite I couldn't understand her or my recitation leader. Apparently she will longer teach at OSU. As I am her last set of classes.

She is definitely an expert in economics, but she fails to understand the basic fundamentals of how to teach college courses. She is hard to understand during lectures and participation is taken every lecture on TopHat, where 50% of the points are accuracy. Be prepared to teach yourself. Exams are worded awkwardly.
Talks slow and notes are clear, her logic is wonderful. Not hard at all.

Worst professor at Ohio State. Lectures consist of her telling current events stories that have nothing to do with class or exam material. Homeworks are frequent and worth nothing. Exam heavy, all exam questions are worded horrifically and many errors in answer choices. Better off reading the book and never going to lecture.

Ida is a educated economist, but poor lecturer. She has open discussions on Carmen to ask any questions we have trouble on and for the homework you get multiple try's to complete it before the due date. Attendance is taken for lectures and recitation on Tophat, and exams are in person. Be prepared to read on your own, her lectures don't help.
She was nice but lectured are a necessity to attend other wise you will fall behind

She is simply not a good teacher. You can tell she knows what she's talking about, she just is a bad teacher. If the whole class got an answer wrong, she would get mad at the class. I think good teachers see that and understand it's because of their teaching if everyone gets it wrong. I used the textbook and received an A.

Ida is possibly the worst professor I've ever had. Lectures are practically useless. She is hard to understand and her teaching is all over the place. The class is not difficult at all, but you pretty much are all on your own and will be teaching yourself out of the textbook. Find another Econ professor.

if you have her- LEAVE. she's a terrible professor, and if you have issues, she absolutely will not solve them. she had never added me to my McGraw hill connect class, and I suffered because of that. she didn't even fix my grade. I wish I could give her a zero

her questions are horribly worded, she does not spend enough time on content. her lectures consist of 45 minutes going over the site and the last 10 to cram all the information from a chapter. Her questions on little homework and chapter quizzes are so poorly worded it costs people points. Complete waste of time, just read the book.

The class wasn't awful, but I definitely hated it. Went to lectures, but couldn't understand her & she didn't make any sense so I stopped going (she posts her lectures on Carmen). EC if you go to lectures, recitation, & if you buy the smartbook. I bought the binder version, read it, and did fine on exams (she drops lowest one). Wouldn't recommend
Hard to understand and replies on the text book too much. Also has a "my way or the highway" attitude. However, there is a good amount of extra credit available.

She is hard to understand but if you pay attention to the notes she writes onto the slides of her lectures then you will do fine. She also always has office hours and encourages students to visit. Finally, she has lectures online but will take attendance through an app on your phone.

She was a very nice woman. however I couldn't understand anything she was saying because of her accent. The lecture was boring and I started falling asleep so I eventually didn't attend lecture in the last month. I read the study guide and book and taught myself and did decent on the final.
It is very hard to understand what she is trying to say.

Horrible! So annoying to listen to and I couldn't understand her. You are competing for your grade, so you can fail the class if you have smart people in there. Read the book and so the study guides, the only way you can pass.
Very slow lectures that go straight from the powerpoint. Studying from textbook/study guide gets you more than attending lecture.

She has such a piercing voice it's hard to understand a word she says.  The lectures are always boring and are read straight from the powerpoint with a few hand drawn notes.  She never once used a hypothetical situation to show the idea she was talking about and left out a lot of key ideas from her lectures that appeared on the tests. Not Good.
You can't understand a word that she says. Don't go to her lectures because you will fall asleep. Study the review sheet before the test. The class is on a cure

Sure Ida's class is boring, but she's decent and not hard to understand. I had Buser for Macro my first semester, and he was a better teacher, but his class was significantly more difficult. I got an A in both but it was easier with Ida hands down. . If you don't get at least a B+ its on you. That's coming from someone who failed micro in H.S...
absolutely horrible communication and so hard to listen to. Tophat's are brutal

Even though this is Dr. Mirzaie's last semester teaching at The Ohio State University, I think it is important to highlight the fact that she is by no means a bad professor as everyone has suggested.  Sure the exams can be tricky, but this is a college course and it should be expected.  I have thoroughly enjoyed my time in her class.

Prof. accused me of academic misconduct due to something that went wrong on my iPad. Despite showing video evidence, she did not believe me and canceled my exam grade. Exams are not open-note and lectures just copy from the textbook. Also a lot of group work for some reason.

Don't know why everybody hates on Ida. She speaks with an accent, but she takes her time to pronounce everything and its pretty easy to understand. She can get boring during lecture, but the class itself isn't that hard and she explains the concepts well.

She isn't easy to understand, no offense to her it isn't her fault that she is not from the US, but it makes her lectures hard to follow. But the class is fairly easy so you shouldnt have a hard time excelling as long as you have a basic understanding of Econ. I would say her grading criteria is tough, and she doesn't give you much room to mess up.

Not a very good lecturer and attendance is weighted extremely heavily. With both lecture and recitation attendance it added up to 25% of the total grade. You will do fine in the class if you read the online textbook and do the practice and quiz each week but expect to teach yourself the material you will not get much out of the lectures.

The only grades are Smartbook readings/quizzes and tests. Tests are only 25 questions. Makes you sit in assigned seats in a class of 540 students. She seems like a great person who does care about her students but she is not a great professor. Oh she also did not let me make up homework missed while I was in the hospital
Terrible teacher , not helpful and rude

When I first got my classes I looked up Dr. Mirzaie and all I saw was bad reviews. After seeing this it made me worried that the class would be very hard. Overall, Dr. Mirzaie is a fairly easy professor as long as you lay attention and do good work. Exams are easy but make sure to study.
Sometimes can be difficult to understand her, but make sure you show up to class for TopHats, those are worth more than they should be

This professor was very uncaring to her students. She isn't understanding at ALL. I was in a major car accident and I had SEVERE scars (that hurt during the cold) and doctor appointments (that made it hard to go to class at times) and when I talked to her about it, she said there was nothing I can do. That dropped my grade from a 94 to a 84.

Dr. Mirzaie is very knowledgeable about economics and did her best to answer student questions online or in lecture. The content was difficult, but it was very possible to do well with effort. Her attendance and participation TopHat questions were a good way to asses understanding of content and her online option made attendance easy/accessible.

Her lectures are pointless just read the textbook chapters she assigns take good notes and you'll be fine it's a pretty easy read tbh. Never listened to the lecture I just had it up for tophat credit so make sure you do that at least. Exam questions are a bit difficult sometimes because the English isn't always the best. Otherwise good course.

Dr. Mirzaie is completely uncaring and inaccessible outside of class time. I had many extenuating circumstances in which I was unable to attend class including COVID, mono, a surgery, and a fire situation. After talking to her about this, she refused to excuse any of these absences. After attendance was in, by grade dropped from a 93 to an 83.

Ida's lectures are not good as she doesn't speak very good English and she was extremely boring. I recommend just using the textbook to learn the material. Tests are easy and answers can be found on quilt.

Ida is not a professor I'd ever take again. I spent the entire course teaching myself all of the content while still being forced to attend lectures where she just reads from the book and complains about how the class doesn't understand the content and doesn't get the participation questions right.

Quite possibly the worst teacher I have had in all of my years of education. She's horrible. Her lectures are insanely boring and she goes on tangents where she complains about the class and the students. If you do go in person, expect her to be extremely rude. PLEASE never take her. She doesn't deserve a job here.

The worst professor ever! She doesn't know how to teach and doesn't care student. She just remove everything from the textbook and asks you to remember exactly the same words from the textbook when doing essay exams. And she never taught ppt in the class just showed bunches of youtube videos. The most irresponsible lecturer ever!

The least engaging professor I've ever had. She clearly knows nobody pays attention to her lectures and the only way she gets people to show up is Tophat questions (which account for a significant portion of the grade). 

Just awful. Avoid like the plague.

She's nice and receptive to questions. Most of the content of the class comes from the online textbook and its assignments. She also assigned a couple of group projects with a group you work with for the whole semester. If you do the assignments and put some time into the class, you'll be fine.

If you dont already have a solid understanding of economics, you might have a difficult time learning the content because it isnt taught very well. If you do know Econ well, its super easy to get an A in.

If you have the chance to select a different professor, you should try to. Especially if you are a business major and need to know the content in order to move forward. This class is pretty straightforward and easy to do well in, but many people stopped attending the lectures a month into the semester because they are very boring. Read the textbook

Professor Mirzaies lecture notes are very messy and hard to read, and there is a lot of content which feels rushed through. The McGraw Hill stuff goes with the online textbook and isnt hard. But the exams dont relate to to any material and you never know what to expect.

This class is on the tougher side, but honestly not too bad if you have a basic knowledge of economics. She gave an extra 2% on our grade at the end for completing SEI's. She does care that we do well, and exams are not too difficult. I barely studied and ended with an A. Freshman reading these bad reviews; you will be fine lol.

This Professor commonly just repeats the notes tied to the homework that is already due, so lectures are largely optional apart from participation point based in class questions. She also has very messy notes during lectures, which makes it very hard to follow along.

She's not the worst professor in the world but you cant have a teacher that can hardly speak English trying to teach complex subjects. She structures her class well for the students sake but its just too difficult to stay engaged when half the battle is trying to understand what she's saying let alone absorbing the material.
Her lectures were just so hard to follow, and the online format was difficult. She really knows her stuff, but she has a hard time communicating it effectively.

Ida was a terrible teacher. She can't speak English well at all which makes her lectures almost impossible to follow. I strictly learned everything from the textbook and didn't pay attention to lectures at all because I didn't know what was going on.

Even though it is online, your attendance is based on TopHat questions, which are generally pretty easy. Ida bases her exams on her lectures, so as long as you go to class, it should all work out well! I thought it was an easy course, but Ida's explanations could be confusing at times. However, it was usually cleared up in recitation.

This class moves quickly, however the key to success is reading the chapter each week. The lectures just cover the book but aren't well organized to easy to understand. She won't answer questions or go over something that wasn't clear, so the best way to understand the material is to read the book.

I believe that there are probably only like three people in the entire class that actually knows what she is talking about. Lectures are so incredibly boring that its hard to keep focused. I learn more when reading the book on my own. Just dont do it to yourself.

Terrible lecturer. Lectures dont teach anything as she just reads PowerPoint, and doesnt make examples other than what is in the PowerPoint. Very very boring lectures. Credit with TopHat. Would suggest steering clear of her classes if possible

Class is not very difficult, the book teaches a lot better than she does which makes it easy. Her lectures are a bit confusing and she does not teach the topic very well. The topics covered though however are not difficult and should not be a problem for someone with any basic knowledge of economics

One of the worst teachers I have ever had, teaches purely concept with numbers and figures rather than going in depth with example and relating to to students. You'll have no choice unless she quits, but wouldn't take her if I had a choice.

Shes a really sweet lady, however she is very disorganized in her lectures and I have a 60% and Ive tried everything to get it back up but I dont understand anything because of how she has explained these concepts. 1/10 wouldnt take it ever again. Im barely making it

This professor was so disorganized, so uninterested, and barely answered questions. Made intro to micro seem like the hardest course in the world. She would refuse answering questions in lectures. She is so disorganized in the lectures themselves. You can barely follow up without losing your mind.

one of the most frustrating profs ive ever had. was not willing to help me when i asked and was extremely rude to students. tests had questions that made absolutely no sense, and she refused to listen to student feedback. switch professors if you get her!!!!

I had Ida Mirzaie for ECON 4200 (Money and Banking). The course consisted of homework assignments, quizzes, Top Hat, five group assignments, and four midterm exams. Ida asked questions on Top Hat during lecture, making class attendance mandatory. The midterm exams were not proctored, but were closed note/book. Ida dropped two quizzes/homeworks.

I despise asynchronous classes. That being said, I would have strongly benefitted from having that to her. Lectures are early, long and boring (I fell asleep in half of them) and really just confused me more than anything. I learned more from the book and quizzes than anything. Tophat questions for participation which is stupid. Bad at giving help.

Ida was one of the worst lecturers I've ever had at the school. She is a smart lady but does not convey the ideas well. Luckily if you do the homework and make review sheets out of the exam prep she gives, you can get a good idea of what kind of questions she will ask on the test. Review Tophat and attend recitation because that will save the grade

Dr. Mirzaie, as a professor, can be very frustrating. The course is easy, but the exams are often riddled with vague and difficult to understand questions, likely due to the language barrier. When the exam average was below her expectation, she was adamant students did not study enough and that the questions were perfect. That was very insulting.

If you do all the homework and think econ will be easy for you, this class is cake. If you struggle with econ, this class will be miserable. You can't take anything away from Ida's lectures and she explains things in a way that makes concepts unnecessarily difficult. DO NOT recommend if you think you'll struggle with this stuff.

She has horrible lectures that are useless, you study the book more than her godawful lectures. She refuses to take accountability for low grades/test scores and just says "study more" (saying were stupid) Avoid this class if you can, and just her in general... Id rather be taught by a toddler than her.
Terribly messy power points with lectures all over the place. Doesnt respond to emails but instead tells students to re-read the directions and figure it out on their own.
Shes super boring and a pretty bad teacher, just rambled on during class and then asks top hat questions she hasnt fully explained.

Partway through the semester I stopped going to lecture because I realized my textbook reading/notes and recitation were enough to pass the class. Sometimes her scribbles during lecture would get me more confused so make sure to utilize TAs for the class and make sure you understand concepts not just specific situations.

Ida is a super sweet lady! However, her lectures were not mandatory and everything she said during lectures was a direct repetition of what we were expected to read out of the textbook that week, so not many people went because it was boring. But with that being said, if you read the textbook you will be fine.

There were quite a few helpful systems put in place amidst the pandemic but no room to mess up beyond those accommodations. I honestly grasped the material more when I just read the book thoroughly and didn't attend every lecture. It was nice having tests every two weeks rather than huge cumulative exams.
Not a good lecturer, however you can get most of the information from the textbook so I didn't attend most lectures.

Uses confusing phrasing on tests such as what is the far truth from ... ? Asks any take on this? after every slide. Tries to force discussions over things most people dont know about. Enters a zero grade on every assignment at the beginning of semester so you never know your actual grade. Worst Econ prof at OSU by far

She frequently had a mini test due Saturday, a quiz and homework due (sometimes 2 of each) on Sunday, then a Carmen quiz Monday. She had a test open on a holiday and didnt change it until multiple people emailed her. Enters zeroes for EVERY assignment for the whole semester so you never know what your grade is. SHE SUCKS

I took econ2001 with Ida 3 years ago, and I thought she was not a bad instructor. However, in econ4200, when teaching harder content, she is not a great instructor by any means. The lectures are extremely boring and confusing. We had SEVEN tests (which means that we have a test per two week), which was insane.

Although Dr. Mirzaie is a very nice individual with a fascinating background, I would have preferred another professor for this class. The online structure for this course was very unorganized, lacked clarity, and we were not able to see our cumulative grade for half of the semester.

Absolutely useless lectures. Her accent is very hard to understand, the notes are illegible and messy, and she just reads the textbook. Spend your time going to recitation, reading the textbook, watching YouTube videos, and practicing problems and you'll be better off, as the course content is difficult and confusing. Avoid her.

useless in lectures, cant understand her, notes are terrible. Recitations are just top hat questions that are designed to trick you. Class is beyond boring. Oh and she gave a quiz on the day of thanksgiving. take this class if you hate yourself.
COVID sucks and scheduling is difficult but giving an exam on the weekend of Thanksgiving is blasphemous and ridiculous. Avoid at all costs

Lack of proper note giving. In economics you need different colors and graphs and accurate notes. Her notes were no were near accurate. Spent half of the semester skipping lectures and learning on my own.

Hard to understand during lectures, and recitations aren't usually helpful. All the work is done through an online textbook which gives you all the information you need to know. Lectures are voluntary, and there are plenty of YouTube videos to teach the content clearly and to the point.
Its ridiculous how she makes recitation mandatory IN A PANDEMIC. WE HAVE LIVES AND THINGS TO DO AND A PANDEMIC OCCURING. Not flexible at all and this class just makes your life harder.
Very boring lectures that make you want to fall asleep and hard to understand her handwriting. Didn't need to attend lectures at all as long as you read the book

Her lectures really made no sense and she just read off the slide and made us do some practice problems. She didn't explain very well but it was ok if you read the textbook. She does drop your worst exam out of three midterms and a final.

Out of my college career I believe Professor Ida has been the worst and most insensitive Professor I've ever had and meet. My experience with Professor Ida has nothing but one of the most emotionally and mentally exhausting semesters of my life. During the semester I set up meetings with Professor Ida and she does not give u a genuine interest.

Hardest class Ive ever taken... and Im honors and took ap in high school. Content wasnt too bad just content presentation in class made everything so confusing. If you do all the readings and really study, you can get a decent grade still tho. Definitely not an easy A, or even an easy B. Ive had a 4.0 so far but barely got a B...

Not even done with the semester yet and truly one of the worst professors Ive had. Dont expect to learn anything from class- just read the book and teach it to yourself. Not to mention shes can be very rude. Dont recommend.
Decent lectures and easy exams, overall good class.
Although she doesnt believe in basic math (to her the slope of a vertical line is only infinity, and undefined is an invalid answer) she drops the lowest exam and homework from your grade.
Lectures are somewhat boring but one exam gets dropped and the class is curved. If you keep up with the online textbook, this class is pretty easy.
Dont go to class it wont help. Just learn by yourself and have tophat open during lectures. Lots of extra credit and lowest test gets dropped. Not as bad as people make her class seem.
Horrible accent and be ready to teach yourself out of the class. No curve or round up, but extra credit is given. However, you will have to purchase 80$ text book to get the extra credit.

Don't make the same mistake twice. As one of Ohio State's notoriously worse professors, if you were unfortunate enough to get her in principles, do NOT take for Money & Banking- she's even worse than she was in principles. If you have no choice, be prepared to teach yourself the material on your own outside of class. Tests aren't hard, & there's EC

Her accent's not that bad and she makes sense, it's just that when she writes on the board, it's hard to understand because she will frequently rewrite over her old work. There never seems to be a clear plan for each lecture either. Lots of in-class activities. It's not that she's mean, she just makes you feel bad for not knowing the material.

Easily the worst professor I've had here at OSU. Impossible to understand on top of being terrible at doing her actual job which is teaching. It's not a terribly difficult class so as long as you teach yourself the material then you should make out okay but try to avoid if you can.

not a good professor at all, luckily lecture is not mandatory and streamed online. i suggest learning on your own and having tophat open during lecture times so youre receiving credit for the tophat questions!

One of the worst professors Ive ever had. She uses slides to teach economics and skips from the 5th slide to the 17th slide back to the 2nd slide. Everything she says is very confusing and not to mention very monotone and boring. I also had a little trouble because sometimes she pronounces her words in a weird way.
no very helpful and her English is Terrible.
English not good. Mean as well
Seriously one of the worst professors Ive had. Shes unclear, wont help if you need it, if she does give you help shell act like youre dumb, and shes plain rude.

Has a bit of an accent, but she's a decent teacher. This class strictly follows the book, so you can just skip lecture/recitation (no attendance) and read the book and pass the class with an A. Really great grading policy, 3 midterms and 1 final but the bottom score is dropped so I didnt take the final. Show up to tests early though!!!

A prominent accent, deficient mic, illegible notes scribbled filling PowerPoint slides, overhasty speech all have resulted in the omission of crucial information and obstructed solid understanding of the content from lectures. The grading system will screw you. Someone may be an expert in a subject but that does not mean they are qualified to teach

Ida is a really sweet lady but her powerpoint don't go into depth on anything. Reading the book helped me the most personally and doing the online homework for extra credit also helps. Quizzes are really hard and the midterms and final are also difficult but use the book to help you out.
Ida is not a terrible lecturer but she could be better. A little boring at times but overall I enjoyed her class. As long as you pay attention and take good notes its an easy A.

The class material is very easy, but the lecture is exceptionally boring and unhelpful; so I did not go to any lectures for 3 months in the semester but still managed to get an A. The tests are extremely easy as long as you read the simple textbook before the tests.

Ida doesn't have the best lectures but the class isn't hard to make up for it. There are 4 tests (3 midterms and one final, but one of the four gets dropped), 9 online homework quizzes (3 get dropped and they are 5 multiple choice each). She offers extra credit for attendance and participation so it should be an easy A if you put in any effort.

Ida's lectures are unbearable. It is tough to understand her under her thick accent and she is not even slightly engaging during lectures. However, by using her powerpoint slides and the book, it is easy to obtain an A in the class. She drops the lowest four quizzes as well as your lowest exam grade (including the final), making the final optional.

I got a 5 on the AP Macro Exam, so Micro was a breeze to me, and I ended with an A without even taking the final exam. She does not explain concepts well, and it's extremely hard to understand her. She will skip around while presenting, so it's hard to follow. Go lectures for extra credit. Read textbook and watch videos, and it won't be that bad.

Ida is very knowledgeable about economics but it can be hard to follow along or stay engaged with her accent. I went to maybe 3 lectures and almost all of my recitations and passed with an A. Its really just about studying the things you dont understand and learning vocabulary. Recitations are a great way to simplify lecture material

Professor Mirzaie was great! With lectures, handouts, online homework, and textbook readings, any student who wishes to do well can do well. There are good extra credit opportunities and the lowest exam grade was dropped. Anyone who complains about not understanding her or her accent is being unreasonable. She is very coherent and understandable.

Even though lectures are online, go to class. Plus youll get bonus points. And recitations are extra credit too and you learn a lot from them. Shes hard to understand but going to lectures are definitely worth it.
Very dry lectures. Often contradicts her slides when she's speaking. Also very thick accent. Very detailed content but does pull some exam questions from the practice quizzes.

I enjoyed this professor, however she might not be for everyone. The grade in the class is determined by a few things, but she also offers extra credit opportunities. If you express your desire to learn in her class, she will be willing to help you.

I personally loved this class and this professor. Gave you plenty of opportunities to succeed and presented material in different ways until entire class understood. If I had time in my schedule I'd take her class again next semester.
The most dry lectures you will find and 90% of your grade is 3 exams that are all only 30 questions. Good luck not falling asleep.
Easy class. Light homework and quizzes. Extra credit. She has accent, but she is very caring and thoughtful.

This was honestly the worst class i've taken by far. For an entry level microeconomics class, it was VERY hard. After studying for hours every week, I still received grades much lower than I think I deserved. The class average on exams was 19 out of 20, and she didn't seem to care. Overall I would NOT recommend anyone take her courses!

For an entry level micro class- a ridiculous amount of work is required. With hours of studying I still received grades much lower than what I expected. Very unapologetic about the average being a 19/30, and a curve was promised after every midterm. There was no curve at the end, except from a 79 to an 80. A tough class and extremely dry lectures.
Extra credit isn't extra credit. It's not graded out of 0 so if you don't do it, it hurts your grade. But for some reason is labeled as extra credit.
Hard to understand during very boring, dry lectures. Read the book and do practice exams and you'll get an A easy.
She just stands up and lectures and isnt very engaging. Yes she puts her lectures online but the exams are always a lot harder than they should be. Having a good TA will help with this class alot
Bad pronunciation for foreign students also 90% GPA came from exams. BAD PRONUNCIATION!!!!!!!!
Lectures are dreadfully boring. I didnt pay attention during lecture but I just reviewed the slides she gives you and was able to come out with an ok grade. Not the best teacher, but not the worst.

A LOT of work is necessary to do well. It's necessary to understand EVERY concept she mentions in class as well as to read the textbook. Her accent isn't hard to understand. Not a great professor, but not awful either. Class is overall pretty boring. If possible, try to find another Econ teacher, if stuck with her, it's not the end of the world.

Idas class is hard, but not impossible. She has a very thick accent you have to get used to. In order to be successful you just need to thoroughly review and learn each chapter as you review them in lecture. Test questions werent always clear.. I worked really hard and ended up with an A- and also didnt have to take the final.

This is a very easy class you can watch lecture online and she uses TopHat for attendance. As long as you read the book its very easy. Also lots of extra credit. She is a bit hard to understand but that class is super easy comparative to a high shool course
Hard to understand, you have to study on your own. Nice person but not the best professor.

She would go over something for 5/10 minutes in handwriting when she has a perfectly clear graphic on the next slide. Youll get more out of just reading the power points than you will out of her lectures. You can drop any one of the four tests between the 3 midterms and the final.

It is extremely difficult to understand her lectures with her accent. The material is not difficult and she posts the powerpoints online. Be prepared to teach yourself. Lectures can be watched online so you can just wait until tophat questions become available to get extra credit for "attending" the lecture.

She is interested in the subject matter, but is super boring in the presentation of the materials day in and day out makes the hour and 20 minute lectures unbearable. Had to sign a sheet everyday for attendance so even if you can learn from textbook or power-points, you still have to show up. Thick accent makes it very difficult to understand.

Best part of this class- you don't have to go to class. She live streams all the lectures so you can watch them on your own time. The content is confusing and she's really hit or miss. Either shell confuse you or you'll understand it. If you buy the online textbook and do your own studying its an easy A (especially bc she drops lowest exam!)

The lectures are kind of hard to listen to, as her accent is very thick and sometimes hard to understand. In-person attendance is not mandatory, however you should watch lectures on line. Tests are very difficult even if you use all the resources available to you in order to succeed. There are four exams and your lowest grade is dropped. Do the EC!
She is boring but hard to understand but material is super easy. The recitation taught ne the most. Can earn bonus points pretty easy. Go watch crash course if you need help or talk to your TA.

Gives three midterms and a final and one of the test grades can be  dropped. Some people do not even have to take the final if they are happy with their grade. It is recommended to listen to lectures and take notes, read the chapters in the book, and do all of the practice problems and extra credit you can to to get the best possible grade.

Ida is a great professor, and she will try to make sure that you feel prepared for the test. She is passionate about the material and uses examples to make you understand it on a personal level. My friends who had her for lower level classes (e.g. Econ 2000) didn't like her, but I loved her for Middle East Econ (4537).

Her lectures are very boring, but she isn't that bad. She does have a thick accent, but it isn't too bad either. The class is only based on 3 to 4 exams and about 8 quizzes. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT, ALL OF IT. That is all...

Ida was an awful professor. First of all, her classes are insanely boring, as she talks in the same monotone voice for 55 minutes. Her slides and examples are so confusing, with unclear examples and sentences that don't make sense. Not to mention her thick accent, making her hard to understand, and her tests, which are so tough & borderline unfair.

She drops the lowest exam score, and every quiz is online. You don't need to go to lecture, because she air's each class online, but make sure to take advantage of the 5% possible extra credit. Tests are very tricky and it would be very difficult to get an A.

HEED MY WARNING. SERIOUSLY. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. ECON IS HARD BUT THIS IS RIDICULOUS. THIS ISNT BECAUSE I HAVE A BAD GRADE. ITS BECAUSE SHE MAKES ME CRY ALL THE TIME, DOESN'T TEACH, AND EVEN HER ANSWERS ON EXAMS ARE /////WRONG/////// YOU WONT PASS DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!! if only i had such a warning!!!!

Accent was not that bad to me. If you pay attention the lectures can actually be quite helpful. The exams themselves were confusing, but if you prepare by doing the quizzes and reading the textbook you'll be okay. Incredibly knowledgable and approachable, I'd recommend asking her questions if you have any.

Horrible lectures. Try to get a different professor if possible. Ida bounces all over during her lectures, she doesn't allow enough time to write down what is on the slide, and she has a thick Iranian accent which can be difficult to understand. The only reason I passed this class was the textbook.

Her lectures were not that helpful to me personally. I took notes outside of class and went to her lectures with a basic understanding of the concept and just asked questions. Very easy grading system because you are allowed to drop your lowest exam grade.

Each professor makes their own exams, I took another teacher's exams to see if it was just her, and I aced the other's exam, but got mid B's on hers. Her exams are worded weirdly and often have trick questions. Also she expects you to make connections people in intermediate econ struggled with. Lots of extra credit opportunities however

Ida has a very thick Iranian accent, it is hard to understand her in lecture. But she presents the exact information word for word out of the book.. Go to recitation, the problems given are very similar to exam questions. She drops the lowest midterm/final. So if you do well enough on all the midterms you will not have to take the final.

Dr. Mirzaie is a very simple and knowledgeable person. She genuinely cares about her students. Top hat questions at the end of every class that count as extra credit. 3 midterms and 1 final. Lowest test gets dropped and you don't have to take final if you're satisfied with your grade. Tests are pretty easy if you read the textbook and go through power points. Online textbook is extra credit

She's a nice teacher and her accent isn't terrible, but the lectures are very boring and they jump around a lot. Also, there will be about 2 questions on every test that make no sense and she won't take them off even though 90% of the kids miss them so be prepared. There's also 5% extra credit in the class which is very helpful.

Her accent actually is not that hard to understand. But I really didn't learn much from her in the lecture, even I tried so hard to focus on what she said. she made me really want to sleep. but the ppt kind of works.

She's not a bad professor, but she is a little difficult to understand sometimes. She seems nice and genuine but she really just reads off the slides and puts them up on carmen. Top hat questions every lecture. DIdn't necessarily learn much from her lectures.
