Ida seems like a very genuine, interesting person. Despite other reviews, her accent really isn't that hard to understand after the first few lectures.  The concepts are a little bit hard to grasp at first, but if you read the text and actually pay attention, they will make more sense. Office hours are helpful. Up to 5% extra credit.

Her accent is not easy to understand. I basically had to read the book and teach myself because her lectures are hard to follow. Recitations are for extra credit. There are 3 midterms and a final, but the lowest of these exams gets dropped. If you are happy with your grade before the final, you do not need to take it. There are also online quizzes.

If you want to read every single page of your economics book, please take this class. Her english is just ok and her lectures do not make sense so don't go. Recitation is worth extra credit and she offers Tophat extra credit which is nice. Just take the class since it is an easy A if you study.

Taking her in a 30-something person upper division class is the way to go. She's incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about the topic, and her office hours are very helpful. She even helped break down a topic I didn't understand in another class that happened to relate to the Middle East. You can get an A if you read and do all of the work/study

Amazing teacher and extremely knowledgeable . Gives small pop quizzes that count as extra credit on the midterm. Very good notes and a simple and interesting group project at the end of the semester. If you are an econ major take at least one class w/Ida. She does not play favorites but will help all of her students equally. I would take her again!

You are better off just reading the textbook, her accent in my opinion wasn't that bad, but she still is very unclear when she tries to explain things. Lectures felt extremely long. The nice thing though that the lowest midterm grade is dropped.

Such a ridiculous class. Yeah she drops one exam grade, but when you get a D on every one after attending every single lecture and studying for over 6 hrs each, that does nothing. TA's are so unhelpful not even funny. Not to mention her handwriting sucks, you can't understand her, and her PDF notes are impossible to take your own notes on.

I'm sitting in Ida's class currently watching Tasty videos online. Her lectures are so pointless that there is zero point in paying attention, I only go to class because she asks Tophat questions for attendance. She has a thick accent and bad handwriting so I don't know what she's saying half the time. Read the book and you'll be fine!!

Lectures are pretty useless. Read through the chapters throughout the semester and then again before exams and you'll pass. Definitely get the online textbook, she gives you extra credit for doing the online problems and they're really similar to exam questions. Homework problems are always different between the online and paper versions.
Attend lecture and be an active participant in recitations and you will succeed.
I cannot believe I passed this class.  She is horrible at explaining concepts on top of her thick accent.
She has I thick accent and is hard to understand during lectures. You pretty much have to teach yourself the content and her tests don't go along with the study guides.
I only go to lectures for the attendance points. I taught myself everything out of the textbook.

The book is incredibly helpful. Class is less helpful, but you can get up to 5% extra credit based off attendance (online attendance for most of classes through Carmen Connect) so still worth going. Exams and quizzes are all multiple choice and fairly simple. She's trying and she cares, but it is a HUGE class and she does have a heavy accent.
Somewhat hard to understand her accent. Class moves very slow, so not hard to get a good grade. Book not completely necessary but, I would recommend it.

She has a pretty heavy accent so she's kind of hard to understand.  Lectures are long and boring and you don't learn anything from her.  Read the book and go to recitation and you'll be fine.  She is one of the worst when it comes to accommodation.  She doesn't help out student athletes much less anyone else and doesn't care about her students.

Could not stand this class. Do not recommend it. She can't speak English so it was very difficult to understand her, you must solely rely on the textbook. I took this course as what I anticipated to be an easy GE credit, I was so wrong. There are only three exams in the entire course and they make up the majority of your grade with only 10% quizzes

She is hard to understand and even then she is hard to follow because she does not convey the material well in lectures. It is not a hard class, but you get no help from the professor. The class is layed out as 90% exams, 10% quizzes, and up to 5% extra credit.
Don't go to lectures. She makes the material hard to understand, but if you read the textbook and have a decent TA you will be more than fine.
The lectures are easier to understand if you read the chapter in the book.
The lectures are easier to understand if you read the chapter in the book beforehand. You get extra credit for attendance and two online surveys. Pretty easy and straightforward class.

Even though her accent is very heavy and it's hard to understand her, the class was very easy.  As long as you study you should be able to get a decent grade.  Also most of the answers for the online quizzes are on quizlet somewhere online.

hardly ever went to lecture. Read my book diligently, went to recitation for extra credit and practice. I realized early on that Ida does a great job at making the material more difficult and confusing than it already is. Her accent is very difficult to understand. go to recitation, read your book, and you will do well

Pretty easy class if you remember to do the assignments and online work. Lets you drop a midterm (or skip the final) and also drops a homework grade and a couple quiz grades. She wanted to use more technology in the class for attendance (polleverywhere) but she didn't fully seem to understand how it works

Ida Mirzaie is a nice professor, who really seems to enjoy what she teaches. She's a little hard to understand sometimes, but if you read your book, you will be fine. Dr. Mirzaie makes review guides before each of her exams and if you know everything on the review guide, you will probably get an A on the exams and in the class.

Ida has a thick accent that is hard to understand. The lectures are boring and hard to pay attention to, but she puts all the slides and lectures on Carmen. I taught myself everything, but the concepts aren't too difficult to grasp if you put the time and effort into it. Quiz and homework answers are online.

Although she has accent and class is not clarity, students can study by themselves from the textbooks and PPT. The quizzes  are harder than the midterm and final in normal. She gives 3 midterm and one final. During this semester, you can drop one of this four exams. I get the 97% in this class. Work Hard and it's not hard to get A

Dr. Mirzaie can be difficult to understand at times due to her accent, but she does seem to care about students. She provides everything given to you in lecture and then some on Carmen. If you read the textbook, do all the assignments, and take advantage of extra credit opportunities, you'll do fine.

She has the unusual, thick accent and it can make it difficult to understand her at times during class lectures. However, I think she genuinely cares about the students and if you make the effort to go to her office hours or ask questions in class, she's more than happy to explain.
Ida is extremely hard to understand. Your only major grades are the midterms and the exam. There is a curve. I would NOT recommend having her as a professor- switch if you still have the chance

Going to lecture is completely pointless. She is hard to understand and the recitation teachers are as well. You will need to completely teach yourself the material by reading the book or through the internet. PowerPoints are posted online with a generous curve and quiz bonus points. Attendance doesn't factor into grade lecture/recitation wise.

If you briefly read the text before lectures, this class is very easy. She spends most lecture time reviewing specific diagrams or ideas from the text. If you haven't read the text before lecture, you will likely be very lost; hence, the passing grade is something like 30 or 35%.

Clarity is very poor when she speaks. You will learn nothing in leature, just go for the bonus points and read your study guide. BUT super generous curve (a much needed one at that). She's very nice and knowledgable, just difficult to understand. You're gonna have to work hard for an A.

going to lecture is absolutely pointless as its impossible to understand her. She stopped offering extra credit for going which removed the last reason to go. Id definitely recommend taking econ with another professir but if you end up with her, just use the book and the internet to teach it to yourself.

Lectures are pointless to go to, and so are recitations. All class learning will come from teaching yourself reading the textbook and doing the practice exams. Grading is curved and should make the class easy as long as you can teach yourself reading the textbook.
Very knowledgeable about Middle Eastern economies (is from Iran), but has trouble communicating ideas. About half the course is oriented around a group research paper.
Ida is very hard to understand due to her strong accent. Only grades are the midterms and final. Class is curved and there's extra credit quizzes. Have fun reading the book and learning on your own.

You'll learn very little going to lecture. She is hard to understand but sweet. She'll spend a long time drawing a graph that's hard to read and then go to the next slide where there is a computer-made one and just skip over it. The TA's are hit-or-miss. Mine was decent but you do need to just red the book and do any review material she gives you.
Extremely hard to understand, to the point where lecture is pointless.  If you get her, plan on reading the book and teaching yourself.

She is tough to understand, and her TA's are even tougher to understand.  The only reason you should go to Recitation is to take the quizzes. Leave after the quiz bc you won''t get anything out of the remaining time. My advice: read the chapter before lecture. There's a website offered through the textbook, do the practice probs on it. I got an "A"

I could see why you wouldnt want to take her lower division classes, but upper division she is incredibly nice and accommodating, Not the easiest, but I was a graduating senior and didnt care much; 50% = C- Class Avg=B- at least (no downgrading) Invited the whole class to her house for dinner and drinks one night. One of the most thoughtful ladies.
Useless lecture. Even more useless recitation. Got an A purely by teaching myself. Don't even bother with micro if you're not a business or Econ major/minor. Find a better Gen Ed.

AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS. She is impossible to understand, makes no effort to help you understand her, goes way too fast in lecture, and her handwriting is atrocious. Her TAs are all useless as well. The extra credit for attending lecture isn't enough to make you want to sit through it. Just all around terrible.

Anyone who said she is a good teacher, obviously has never had one. Not only is she impossible to understand but her practice exams are nothing like the ones she gives out. I'm a Econ major and this was the most disappointing class I've taken thus far in my college career. Safe yourself the time and effort and avoid any class with her.
Cannot understand what she said at all and I learnt NOTHING from the course. If I have a second chance, I will NEVER take her class.

Ida is a nice prof who can be difficult to understand at some points due to her heavy accent but it's not actually too bad. If you study the book and use the study guide the midterm and quizzes aren't too bad. You just have to put real effort and studying into this class and it gets interesting.

Very thick accent and lecture is IMPOSSIBLE to pay attention in. You do get extra credit for going to lecture but it's almost not worth it. Study guide is a must because you'll be learning most of it by yourself. I'd try to find another professor to take Econ from.

Struggled everyday to understand a full sentence that came out of her mouth.  Her accent is extremely thick and she doesn't slow down to help you hear her.  I went to lectures and put headphones in and read the book and taught myself.  Definitely buy the practice problems book.

this teacher has such an accent that I had to learn all the material on my own. grades are 25% exam 25%exam 50% final exam. you get 3% for attending, and 3% for extra credit quizzes. this teacher SUCKS!! going to her class is pointless. even my TA fell asleep. and another said go to class and listen to music.

Microecon. She has a very thick accent, but makes and posts slideshows for each chapter online so it's very easy to skip class and study on your own. If you take more than 2 hours to study for tests you'll get an A, I'd recommend getting the practice questions book because her test questions come out of that. recitations helped
She is nice and all, but don't expect to learn much from going to class.

Shes nice and knows her stuff. That being said you can't understand a word she says or writes. You have to be able to teach yourself and read the book. Some extra credit. Overall I would highly recommend NOT taking her class. There are many better professors at OSU.

You have to learn all by yourself ok?Study guide!!!go buy it!!! Do you know how many people fall into sleep on her classes? If the attendance is not for the extra credits, no one would show on the class ok? This final breaks my heart seriously, i did well in the midterms and this final is way harder than I thought. How could she do this do us!!

She's the worst there's really nothing else to say. In terms of the class it's not that difficult and she gives some extra credit for attendance and there's a decent curve. She's the worst. Absolute worst. Boring, rude, demanding she is just awful.
She is awful to listen to due to her thick accent and monotonous tone, but if you can pay attention, you will do fine.

Despite the fact that Ida is hard to understand & going to lecture basically  worthless, TAKE THIS CLASS.  There's a very generous curve.  Attendance in lec and rec quizzes are both extra credit.  If you just read the textbook, go to class,   know that everyone is struggling, and stay above the curve, you'll be fine.

I don't agree with people who say this professor wasn't helpful. Going to class certainly helped me. She would draw graphs and explain them which helped a lot. Plus there extra credit and a decent curve for the class. She was willing to help students if asked. She may be a little hard to understand at first, but really isn't that bad.

Even as an econ major, I can't say I particularly enjoyed her class (Microeconomics.) Upperclassmen tell me her major classes are good, but she just does not teach well to a huge lecture. Her class was easy tho, especially with extra credit for attendance and quizzes and a curve.
One of the worst teachers I have ever had. You cannot comprehend anything she says.

I would not recommend taking a class with her. She is difficult to understand. She is a horrible teacher, and doesn't explain anything well. Anything that I learned in that class, I taught my self or from the recitation teacher. She just reads of slides, and you can't understand her hand writing. Do yourself a favor, and avoid her.

Really just quotes out of the book and reads off the powerpoint that she also puts online. Not good AT ALL at explaining things.  Every time I go to lecture I just get more confused :(  The only good thing about lecture is that you get extra credit for going. Recitation more useful than lecture! If you dont HAVE  to take this class, then dont!

i would NEVER recommend anyone to take this class: terrible teacher, she does not help you, i tried to go in for help- absolutely hopeless she says read book do practice problems, does not clarify anything, hard exams, doesnt even get through notes in class in time for quizzes on fridays honest. in order to pass be ready to TEACH YOURSELF

Had to teach myself from the text book, she's hard to understand, and really bad at applying it. She gives extra credit for attendance and is somewhat nice with grading (although the way she grades exams is really weird)

Go to class because you get 5% added on to your grade at the end. Also, read the book. All of the MC on her tests are from the book, and her problems are almost directly from what she does in class/on the worksheets she hands out.

I don't really think I learned anything from her class...She changed textbooks this time and seemed completely unprepared to adapt to it. She was nice enough with her grading, but overall the class was a bit of chaotic in terms of consistency, and it wasn't really a class you had to dedicate a lot of time to

Easy class. Attendance is mandatory however she offers extra credit if you go to lecture/recitation. I guarantee half the class would not show up to lecture considering she just reads off lecture slides but she knows what she's talking about and is very knowledgeable on the subject.
Great class, great teacher a must take for anyone interested in Macro Econ. Her tests were fair and the group projects were not to difficult.

Don't know why I continued to go to lecture - first, her English is quite poor, and second, half the time her powerpoint slides don't work - so she writes notes on the projector, and her handwriting is awful too!  If you take her class, expect to have to read the book in order to succeed.  If you do, you should have no problems.

Not an easy A, but she did offer 6% extra credit after the curve. While the course material is boring, she does try to show helpful videos in lecture. Recitations are pointless and I never opened the book and still received an A-

She expects you to really learn and actually be able to apply everything, yet she does a poor job of teaching in lecture and only 20% of the class will get an A or A- based on the way she curves.Don't take her if you just want an easy A
A very easy econ class to get an A in but if you actually want to understand it and be engaged with economics avoid at all costs.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. She is easy enough-- 3 tests, short presentation, and article summaries. We got 5% of extra credit for attending class, too. But she is THE MOST BORING PROFESSOR I've ever had. And don't plan on actually learning anything from her.

Ida was is  a good prof. but class was boring. Tests are split between multiple choice (from the book) and work problems (from the examples she does in class). Exams aren't difficult if you read the book. Go to lecture - you get 5% extra credit just for good attendance. She's helpful one-on-one also. Take advantage of current event discussions

most boring class i have ever taken! I fell asleep in almost every lecture and I've skipped a lot of the lectures because i felt they were so useless that i didnt even need to go I cant understand her very well english is very broken recetations saved me in learning the material lecture is all over the place and not very organized at all. bad prof.

She is very hard to understand and does not do a good job at getting the material accross to the students period. we watch a video one day in class and i learned more in that one video than the whole course. She speaks very broken english. If you take this class you are better off reading straight from the textbook. course is weighted.

Yawn...this class with Prof Mirzaie is a lullaby.  You will fall asleep or begin to do other work.  If you expect to do well you must read the book on your own and comprehend most of the information as well.  She shows examples on the powerpoint, but is all over the place.  I'd look for another lecturer if possible.

Prof. Mirzaie is the most boring professor I have had so far as a student at Ohio State. I felt as though I had to force myself to stay awake every class, but this did pay off in the end. Two tests and a final, and she goes over many of the questions on the tests in class. Use the book and study guide - in the end this separates the Bs from the As.

Ida, while not a bad teacher in the slightest, taught in a very boring manner.  Every lecture was just going over powerpoints on the overhead, and I'll admit I fell asleep about half a dozen times.  Nevertheless, she's very helpful and can put the needed concepts across, but expect to be using the book or your recitation a lot to cement the info.

I am an international student from China,  i don't recommend this professor for inter students.Pro.M has a heavy Iron accent which almost drives me crazy. i was trying to attend the lecture but i could not understand~!  the midterm is not that easy. u can choose better professor.

Class time with Dr. Mirzaie is almost unbearably boring, all class is spent looking at typed powerpoints and nearly zero interaction with us. DIdn't know anyone's name (strange for an honors class) and was not helpful during office hours. Got a worse grade than I deserved, midterms and finals covered material that wasn't covered in class/reading..

She's hard to understand, boring, and everything needed for the exams can be learned by simply reading the book.  She thoroughly believes that if you sit in the back half of the class, you are NOT paying attention. In fact, I wasn't paying attention, but still earned an A by cramming in the 4-5 chapters before each exam. :)

Man this class was boring.  Insanely easy, but boring.  She seems to expect this result too, because she gives you extra credit for coming to class.  I had no interest in econ, I just took it cause its supposed to be super easy (it was), and honestly, I don't know if I would recommend it because it is just that boring.
Despite her accent and frequent omission of grammatical articles, she communicates economic concepts quite effectively. I recommend. Also: getting an A is so easy a caveman could do it.

Great teacher. If you pay attention in class and ask questions you will learn a lot. Fairly easy to get an A but you have to study a moderate amount. She cares and wants students to learn. 5% extra credit for attending class.

If all you are interested in is passing the class, you probably won't mind Mrs. Mirzaie.  However, if you want to learn a lot about economics you'll be disappointed.  She is an extremely easy grader - 50% guarantees you a C - but only covers the bare minimum amount of material.  Her thick accent also makes understanding what she is saying difficult

Difficult to understand, grading system makes class moderately easy-but she has NO idea how to teach and expect to have to teach yourself from the textbook and study guide that accompanies it. Doesnt speak good english at all either, have fun and good luck trying not to fall asleep

Very straightforward.....read the chapters she tells you to and know the concepts and you WILL get an A in the class...and she curves the class so if you dont get an A you should have probably gone to CSCC

quizzes r super easy and count as extra credit. Mid-term 1 n 2 r harder than final. Hardly go to class. just read the book on my own and review ppt before tests. easy A. but she's not so clear.. and class is a lil bit boring... i like the TA though. her name is Sieber,Soo...nice and helpful.

Before this class I loved economics and was very interested in it. Now I dont want to take another econ class again. She made the class very difficult and I could not understand a word she said. She is always willing to answer questions though.

Attending the class defintely helps a lot for the exam. She explain the mateirals clearly in class. No need to do a lot extra works outside the class.But the exam and quiz are knid of hard.Participants give up to 5% bonus points. You have to finish a project before final. Seriously, no need to read the book.

Avoid this teacher. She makes this class way to difficult for a econ 200 course. She is extremely boring and hard to understand. The class avg on the exams is usually like a 60%. How....eva she curves alot. dont bother going to class you'll just fall asleep.

this professor, and class can be classified as just irritating.  Subject matter isn't too difficult, she gives out a fair share of A's and B's however lectures are so boring and madatory.  I became more infatuated with the words that she pronounces wrong than i did with macroeconomics.

The class turned out to be mostly discussion based. Most days we would not make it all the way through the planned power point lectures-but you had to know the material you aren't tested on the discussion. Multiple Choice sections on exams were very easy, the problems were difficult, but she was willing to help. She curves well, I went from B+ to A

(con't from the previous review)...on the final, she allows a 1 page index card of notes (which must be turned in with the exam). She curves the class at the end, individually using 2 of her methods (which she'll explain in class). Whichever method is beneficial to that certain student's grade, she'll use it. Good professor!

She has an accent, but is still very understandable. Her lectures pretty much summarizes the readings, so if you read, you're good for an A. Allows 6 (drop lowest) 'pop' quizzes (not really, my TA announced the dates) to be counted as up to 5% EXTRA CREDIT. Quizzes, midterms, & final are multiple choice. Really helpful to and care about students.
Sometimes pretty hard to understand. Her lectures were mostly pointless if you do the reading then you will be fine without having to go. The class was overall pretty easy though.

Lectures lacked organization and showed little preparation. Tests straight from book content. Lectures useless but attendance mandatory, still not hard to get an A if you read the book and go to class.

She explained concepts in a very awkward way...hard to understand. If you ready the book/take notes, you'll be fine. Sometimes lecture is helpful...but you really have to teach yourself from the textbook/study guide. Recitations are alright if you can understand the teacher (they're all Asian usually).

An extremely helpful and knowledgeable professor. The content and graphs can be difficult, but she is more than willing to meet with you and take questions during class to help you understand. The accent is not hard to understand as long as you are coherent during lecture. Wonderful and very helpful instructor.

Really?!?  WORST class ever. Way too much material gone over too quickly. Unnecessarily confusing choices for multiple choice answers.  Practically every question is a trick question, if there is a way to throw the wrong answer among the choices she will do it.  No relevant examples to make this class useful or relatable in any way.  Very hard.
BORING!!  Study. Prepare to be yelled at- she doesn't understand the concept of a microphone.
Lectures aren't mandatory, but if you have a hard time understanding foreigners, I do not advise this class.

Extremely boring lectures, a horrible joke of a textbook, and a mediocre study guide. This class was a waste of my time (as I suspect will be the case with every GEC). If you want to take economics, you should probably take H200 instead.

As long as you read the book and worked with the study guide the exams were fairly easy. She gives an amazing curve, in Econ200 an 85 ended up being an A. Also the accent exists, but isn't too  bad, if you go to lecture you can adapt.
Not necessary to go to lectures you will just fall asleep. You have two midterms and a final with a few bonus quizzes never any homework or papers. Overall a fairly easy class.
Lectures are almost worthless.
She was genuinely interested in students doing well. Although lectures weren't necessary, they were really helpful, and she was willing to answer questions via email.

Lectures are so boring! Actually she's very fair in grading, and she gives out extra credits points. So It is not that difficult to get an A in this class. Exams are not so difficult if you really study the textbook. Going to class is just wasting your time by listening to a lecture that will confuse you.

Going to lecture is a waste of time.  She is not organized when talking about topics so the lectures are confusing.  If you take her class you are better off reading the book, working on the study guide, and going to office hours for help.
Had her for H201 and H520. Great teacher, grades fairly

I hated this class. I took it at the same time as my friends, but they had different professors and did extremelyw ell. I didn't understand half the stuff she said. I think she knows a lot, but has trouble getting it out. Not an easy A!
The subject matter is fairly interesting, but she's so boring that I had lots of difficulty paying attention. An Easy A if you're willing to try, but she makes it difficult to...

Lectures were very boring, just read through powerpoints verbatim with a few example problems. Posts all notes online prior to class so going to lecture is not necessary. The chapter outlines and practice quizzes in the workbook more than prepared me for the exams, which were very easy. Quizzes in recitation are purely bonus points.

This class was horrible. I learned absolutely nothing. And the sad part is that I have an interest in Economics. I can tell you more about her personal history (moving from Iran to Sweden to Georgia to Ohio) than I can about Macro Econ!!! She's not overly hard, it's just very difficult to prep for exams since you haven't learned anything!

Accent is annoying to listen to, lectures werent neccessary. I ended up not going to them and just read the book which i understood better. Study guide was useless and didnt really help. However, the lowest grade you could get was a C- and the curve was pretty nice. If you do bad on the midterms and good on the final, your final is doubled.
horrible. Strong accent and difficult to understand.  Lectures are not helpful and exams are tough
Very, very nice and helpful, but she did not communicate the very well. Exams are difficult and it is hard to gauge what will be on them.

Lectures could be somewhat boring but she did seem to care that we understood.  Her accent really isn't that bad; I never had a problem understanding her and she understood that she had an accent and had no problem with us asking her to repeat herself.  The midterms and final weren't too difficult.  Read the book and use the handouts to study.
I wouldn't reccommend her.  She is too hard to understand and the lectures are boring.
easy class. skip the lecture, read her textbook regularly, do the multiple choice in study guide. Not hard to get an Ab
Tough material, but she is patient with her students.
Extremely difficult to understand due to Persian accent.  Some what difficult, and seemed distant to the students.  All TAs are Chinese.  WTF?!
Easy enough if you go to class and stay awake...

Don't Take Her. She makes what could be  semi-interesting subject not only boring but much more difficult than necessary.  Lectures are awful and no different then reading the text.  Midterms are near impossible however there is a decent curve. Basically much more work then Mumy's class! Take him
very good

Dr. Mirzaie was an ok professor she's somewhat hard to understand because she's from Iran. Her notes are generally pretty good to study, but the study guides that she gives for the tests have everything on them that you'll need to know. You can take just the final because she will double it if it's better than your midterms.
She is very nice and willing to help. The class is not easy but you can get a good grade. I recommend this professor.

Friendly and tries to help everyone in class but it is difficult to understand her in general. She is unclear; I ended up not going to lecture and reading the book myself because she confused me. Extra credit quizzes are nice, also you can drop the midterms and double the score of your final exam for your final grade.
Nice person, but a bit hard to understand. Ended up barely going to lectures, but if you read the text it isn't hard to get an A
No Comments
No Comments

I have never taken statistics before, but he reviewed everything at a good pace. There are only 4 problem sets with a few problems and 2 exams that he prepares you well for. The last couple weeks you have a lot of time to draft a final paper. If you attend lectures and take notes, getting a high A is very feasible.
Super engaging, loved this class! It was pretty easy, if you showed up and did the practice problems.
She cannot teach.

One of my favorite classes I've taken at OSU. The content can be hard at times, but if you go to class (and pay attention), it's nothing too bad. Very interesting subject, and Dr. Oostrom does well to keep the class engaging. If you show up and participate, you'll do fine in the class.
She threatened me, and I am afraid of her. She is pretty mean.

Professor Oostrom is clearly brilliant. She demands a lot of her students and I think that can catch people off guard, but she definitely supports those who are willing to work hard. I learned a ton in her class.

Professor Oostrom is a great teacher. I enjoyed the topic way more than I thought I would! The class is challenging and at first I stressed a lot about the grading, but fortunately it's graded on a curve.
Professor Oostrom made the class a place I enjoyed to be in! She is a great teacher and I am so happy to had the chance to take this class

Okay. At first I was upset about the low grades, but everything is curved and she is one of the kindest and most helpful professors I've had. I appreciated the in-class discussions and the attempts to make zoom engaging.
Tough but there is a huge curve so even with 60-70% on assignments you can get a good grade. Made a meh topic (health policy) interesting

By far the worst professor Ive ever had. She doesnt know how to teach and the class average for every assignment was a D or F. Tests were ridiculously long. She does not show any compassion towards her students. Would give students attitude when they didnt understand what she was saying. Do not recommend a class with her. Your gpa will tank.
Believe me, besides this professor, you must have another better choice. The exam and grader are tough!
She is so confusing and it is not easy by any stretch to get an A in this class. If I could do it over I would have taken a different class.

The professor wasn't the best at explaining the material in the lecture so I had to look up a lot of the terms and information online to get a better understanding. The reading helped me more than the lectures to be honest.

terrible class. offers little help and does a bad job explaining any topics. only grades class on the two midterms and the final. no homework or additional practice questions. does not prepare you for exams at all. slides aren't her own and are old. did not provide with a textbook we should buy or any reading material. i have learned nothing.
As long as you do well on homework and show an effort, he will make sure you pass.
Very nice Professor. Sincerely cares about his students.
Good to get exam points, Clear lectures, Willing to help students
He does not have the patience to teach.
It's not easy because you literally won't follow the lecture if you take a look at your phone. But the logic is not that difficult to understand, plus there is a huge curve.

It is not to deny that the lecture is a little bit boring. However, his lecture is inspirational, and we can learn a lot from his lecture if we focus on the lecture. Homework is pretty useful for us to get ideas about what the exam looks like. It is difficult to understand the material without the help of homework. logic is more important than math

HORRIBLE! Do not take this professor! Game Theory is very difficult content, and Yang sincerely did not help in the slightest. I am graduating this semester and he is the worst professor I have ever had. The content is extremely tricky, and he sincerely does not teach it. You have to try to teach yourself from the book and it is so frustrating.

This guy flat out sucks. If you're taking game theory, we will tell you the concepts to know but you're on you're own when it comes out how to actually apply these concepts to homeworks and exams. The class average of our first exam was a 65 which is ridiculous especially for an economics course.

Dr. Yang recognizes that this is a difficult course for undergraduates. He will give you a generous grade at the end of the term if you demonstrate your effort by doing homework, participanting in lectures. I received a lot of lessons from this course that will serve me throughout my career and life in general.

This was a particularly challenging class at OSU. The textbook and professor administering the class were not great choices. Lectures were often confusing and the textbook did not clarify much outside of class. Homeworks were few but very difficult. Unfortunately the weight of the midterm was 30% and the final worth 40%.

Just wanted to stick up for Prof. Yang. His lectures are identical to the textbook, but I thought this was one of the things that made the class easy. Tests were reasonable. Gives extra credit. Super nice guy.

I got an A, but that was because I was already somewhat familiar with the material. If you come in knowing nothing, it is unlikely Dr. Yang will do anything to help your understanding and you will have to teach yourself.

The lecture notes are verbatim from the text and there is no other place to look for help on the subject. The book/class examples are all very simple models and then the HW is so much more complex than the HW its stupid. Also, the final is worth about half your grade so hope you do well or the entire semester was pissed away.

Information Economics. I audited the course. He was very well prepared despite having a new baby in his family. He asked thought provoking questions; gave many helpful economic insights into the material. Very knowledgeable in this field. Very open and accessible to questions in class.

One of the worst professors Ive ever had.  Nothing made sense to anyone in the class and claims the tests are based off the homework, but I got 90% and 100% on the homeworks and failed the midterm (class average was 61%, which he said was good?)  Had to drop to save my GPA...take with someone else.  Otherwise its like an online class=teach yourself

His exams were so hard! You have to write all your answers on the blue book. There are some T or F questions but you still have to explain to get points. Class average for the mid term was 59% and 51% on final. He said the final was similar to the HW assignment which wasn't. I've heard Yod's exams are all multiple choices and much easier.

Professor Li, was hard to understand and boring in lecture. I found myself supplementing his lectures with youtube videos - Jacob Clifford. However, he designs the class that almost everyone can get an A if the effort is there with extra credit opportunities, it's a decent amount of work though.

No hate to Li, he is a great person, it is just hard to learn during his lectures. They usually seem dry and hard to pay attention since he's just reading off the slides. However, he is a fast responder, and will bump grades if needed. He cares, but his lectures are just hard to pay attention in, and this class is lecture heavy.

impossible to understand. lectures are full of material that will never be touched on or explained. can barely hear him during lecture and is very hard to follow the powerpoints because its just random bullet points and no explanation on how they interact or affect anything. not to mention the final being the hardest final ive ever taken. avoid

Worst Professor or teacher I have ever had. His lectures are full of pointless/poorly worded things. To pass, you need to read the book and teach yourself. Extremely difficult quizzes and will not help you much if you ask.
Although his lecture is hard to understand, he gives us lots of extra credits which is helpful for the final grades. Its not hard to get an A if you attend the lecture.

He's very kind. He gives 20 credits for the attendance and SEI, which is helpful. Quizzes are group quizzes, and there are totally 7 homework, which is not heavy. He is accessible and very patient. It's not difficult to get a great grade.

Do not take this professor. He is hard to understand and reads directly off of the slides. Went to his office hours and he was very unhelpful. Homework is not hard but there are some very specific questions. Also never responds to emails. There are much better professors for this class. Avoid
Class is unclear and exam don't have different versions.
Nice experience in total

Overall the class was fairly easy. The homework and tests were completely doable and overall it was easy to get an A. Additionally, there was lots of extra credit offered which helped. I thought he was nice and always willing to help!
very hard to understand him but he seems nice. Attendance is extra credit. 7 homework assignments, 1 midterm and 1 final. Uploads all notes to carmen

Zheyu is helpful outside of class, has useful practice exams/HW Solutions, is willing to answer questions, and genuinely cares about your experience in the class. Plus she offers awesome extra credit! But, there were abstract lectures & unclear communication on what will/won't be tested. Solid teacher but expect to put in a good deal of work.
So far the worst professor I've had at OSU, one of the hardest lectures to follow. To succeed study the homework. Prepare to teach yourself 95% of the time.
the textbook and her lecture material are on two different planets. Very hard to understand. Does not employ any calculus for a class that should be calc based.
Hardest class. The lecture is disorganized. Her explanation is very abstract.

(Adv Course, # I took not listed)

Extremely good professor. Great lecture notes, explains clearly without skipping on intuition, and (at least my semester) recorded all the lectures so they were easy to go back to and review. He also designed his homeworks in a way that actually taught the concepts and gave opportunities for practical application.
i like him very helpful. exams are very very easy

If you have to take Econometrics, this is the professor you want. He goes out of his way to make a somewhat difficultboring subject matter understandable. He seems to really care that students understand the material. Homework assignments are time consuming, but the exams weren't too hard if you go to class. I would his class again.

Jason is a really smart professor. He is patient and willing to help the students. The HWs are a little difficult. However, if you work hard, you will get a good grade finally. I think some people think the class is tough because the Economictrics is tough. If you have to take Economitrics, choose this guy!

I was ahead of the chapters at the beginning and received a 96% on the 1st midterm. By the 2nd midterm I had a D & on the final I got a C. I had trouble staying on top of all the chapters we covered but made it a point to do all the homework assignments even if I wasn't confident about them. He is a kind grader and sweet guy! Overall grade was a B-

This may be one of the worst professors I have had at OSU. He is a brilliant man, but has a tough time conveying the material to the students. His exams have a lot of material that is not on the review. He makes subjects more complicated than they need to be. The first exam is the easiest so take advantage of it. He is willing to help tho.

Good teacher for what is a boring subject. 2 midterms and a cumulative final. 1st midterm extremely easy. 5 HW's that are somewhat challenging but manageable. I'd recommend going to class b/c some of the topics can be challenging and unclear. Definitely the guy you want if you have to take econometrics.
great

Dr. Lavetti has been my favorite prof so far in college. He cares a lot about his students and he wants everyone to succeed. Reading the textbook was very helpful in this class as some of the models are very intricate and dense. This is an excellent 5000+ class for econ majors.

Lavetti is amazing, but Econ 5860 is the hardest class I've ever taken in college. The models presented are DENSE. However, if you're an Econ major, this is a great 5000+ credit to take. While the material is impossible, he curves the midterm, final exam, and final grade heavily. My B- got curved up to an A come final grade time.

Mr. Lavetti was awesome. This was easily my favorite class ever taken at OSU. The material is tough, but he gives a HUGE curve. I originally got a C on the midterm and it was bumped up to an A. Lectures are very interesting and he knows what he's talking about.
It's super easy to get an A in this class. You can tell that the professor does care about what she teaches I just found it a little boring.
Lectures were long and boring. Content wasn't explained super well.

Dr. Plakias is a really nice person, but the lectures are long and boring. Hard to stay engaged sometimes, you'll find a lot of people sleeping. Totally not her fault that the content she teaches is really dry, but she gives a lot of review material and sessions before each exam. Studying a few days in advance is a must for each exam.

Very easy class. She gives one hw assignment most weeks (sometimes none), but they are very easy to do and match with her lecture presentations (that she uploads). The exams are similar to these hw assignments, so they are a good place to study. She also offers EXTCRD for the people who attend class. The content was also pretty interesting.

Plakias is so nice and her class was very easy. Weekly homework assignments were helpful & allowed you to really learn the material for the exams. Exams were also easy. Lectures were kinda boring, but she does a good job breaking the material down. Drops the lowest exam grade, so if you do well in the class, you don't have to take the final

Dense lectures but she tries to break them up a bit. Weekly homework which basically requires you to go over the slides/notes again. Tests only cover material on homework, so reviewing those are a great way to study. I found attending lectures very helpful to complement and clear up some materials on the slides.

There are homework problems that are done (typically) weekly. Then there are exams (drop lowest). Make sure to do the homework with someone else in the class and then make sure they are graded appropriately! She does not cross check between herself and the TAs. You are better off learning the material from the slides then going to class...

I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS CLASS. He is the worse teacher Ive ever had. If you think this is an intro course, be prepared to do senior work. I have a friend who is taking the same course, different teacher and are learning totally different. We reported an assignment to the Econ department and they said it was too hard for intro. Dont take this.

Dr. Nencka really cares about your success in the class. He relates many concepts in class to real-life phenomena. Material is quite accessible, yet you get a good base of econometrics for an undergraduate level through practice in R. There is no textbook and you might want some reference material outside of class. All in all, take him

I love Peter. One of my favorite professors and a nice guy. He is super flexible and wants you to succeed and his class is pretty straightforward. He is also funny but in a quirky way. Like once I got a concussion on my way to the exam and he was so understanding and kind! Made this boring class enjoyable for me. Take him if you can!

He's a grad student so he wants to make sure he teaches well. Class is easy if you show up and you won't need the textbook unless you want to skip class every class. Overall he made it fun and taught interesting material i didn't expect

Made sure we understood before moving on and provided excellent feedback for every assignment. Easy readings, you will need book. 4 HW (and 1 EC to drop lowest HW), reading quizzes to encourage attendance, 1 midterm (do HW and you'll be fine), and 1 final project (sectioned off into mini assignments to make it manageable). Highly recommend.
Im knows what he is doing, but really isn't there for you. You better know what you are doing, or face a lot of problems.

Professor Roy lacks the ability to teach the information to a normal student. By that I mean that in order to actually do well in his class you better have the ability to memorize hundreds of PowerPoint slides. It is impossible to learn anything in his class. DO NOT TAKE
He doesn't know how to use canvas and grades assignments very poorly. Lectures are very dry and difficult to understand, poor teaching ability.

Easily the ABSOLUTE WORST professor I've ever had. He makes attendance mandatory, which DOES matter because there are only four grades all semester (attendance, MidTerm 1, Midterm 2, Final Exam). He constantly contradicts himself in his lectures. His lectures are extremely boring and confusing. He does not give any help. Does not answer emails.

Professor Roy made this class so much harder than it should have been. Exams are 75% of your grade and all of the averages on these exams were Fs. The lectures were terribly boring ,and the assignments did not help when it came to exams. I highly recommend finding a different professor if you have to take this class.

Won't answer emails Everything he puts on the study guide, most of will not be on exams Goes over topics one time and if you don't speak up loudly then he moves on and you are expected to have 100% mastery over them Easily the worst professor I have had and many will agree

This professor made the class way harder than it was supposed to be. The average grades for our midterms were both F and below averages. Also, he could really care less about being specific in lectures on the crucial subject matter in Macroeconomics. You really just have to cross your fingers and hope that you can guess your way to a good grade.

Flies through material, very few assignments outside of the exams so not much of a chance to redeem grade. Hard to understand and overcomplicates explanations. Does not give students a chance to even find the answer to a question before he answers himself. Very sweet person, but does not help the fact that I haven't retained a single thing all sem.

No worksheets , just board examples every so often. You have 3 grades in the class, midterm 1 & 2 + final exam. Also takes attendance. Can be hard to understand him. Lectures are boring and lengthy. If you are looking to learn and understand macro-econ I wouldn't recommend this class. Exams are hard; highest grade on exam 1 in my class was 14/20.

Prof. Roy was okay, at best. He was sometimes difficult to understand and contradicted himself quite a bit in his lectures. His lectures are pretty boring, but attendance was for a small grade. Most of the final grade (80%) came from the 2 midterms and the final.

This man is so hard to follow. Lectures were long, boring, unengaging. I absorbed little to no content during classes. If you dont ask questions, he glazes over complex topics. Macro Econ should be an EASY A, but this man turned this course into one of my most challenging course loads. Only take if you want macro to feel like pulling teeth

He's fairly intimidating, but incredibly good professor. I hated econ classes, but Prof White made it very interesting through his lectures. The class is very straightforward, the homework is very reasonable, and if you go to his office hours he is actually approachable and very helpful. Tests are very similar to homework. 10/10 experience

Prof. White is one of my favorite professors! There is a simple way to get a good grade. You go to lectures, participate a little, read a little, then you're fine. His tests are pretty straight forward. The group project sucks if you have a bad group but Bill is willing to help you out if theres issues. I wish more profs were like him. A real gem.

Professor's White's Government Finance in the American Economy is pretty straightforward: go to class, do the homework, and pass. There isn't much to it. He explicitly said considers it an AP class, so, it's designed to be fairly easy.

Dr. White is incredibly knowledgeable about the field of economics, and sometimes comes off as intimidating. That said, hes very clear with what his expectations are and as long as youre doing the work that he assigns and participating in the lectures.. you shouldnt have any issues doing well in the class

Professor White is an incredible professor. He gives very thoughtful answers to class questions and encourages students to participate. His class isn't very difficult as long as you pay attention to the material and seek help whenever you need it. As long as you respect him as a professor, he will respect you as a student.

I really enjoyed having Dr. White. His lectures were engaging and easy to follow, and the class as a whole was pretty easy. There weren't many tests, and we were given plenty of review material for the exams we did have. He's an easy grader overall!

Lectures were interesting & pulled in examples from recent history & he put a lot of emphasis on asking questions/participating in the class discussions. He also always had personal anecdotes that he would tell us about related to the lectures. Not hard to do well if you show up, participate, & do your work. Super interesting class & good prof!

He makes sure to call on people during class so make sure you go. This class was mainly based on group work so if you don't have a good group that will help you, you're basically stuck doing the work yourself. The grader grades really weird and really doesn't offer an explanation of why points were taken off.

I really enjoyed Prof. White's class. He's very knowledgeable, with vast personal experience that he draws upon during class to synthesize what we've learned. His assignments aren't too difficult IMO, as long as you're comprehending the topics from lecture. Always struck me as accessible & eager to help. Taking another class w/ him this semester.

Professor White gives long, boring lectures that don't go in depth about understanding the material but instead provides a bunch of random real-world applications. Tests are difficult, even after putting lots of time in to study. Added a ton of assignments at the end of the term that shot my grade down low, after putting in final. Do not take him.

Lectures aren't very engaging, which isn't helped by the fact that the content itself isn't very exciting for most people. He also takes an entire class to say climate change and air pollution aren't really problems. He's clearly not an environmental scientist and no one took him seriously. He was upset when students laughed. Truly ridiculous.

I cannot say that I loved the class, but Bill himself is a good professor. The 3 exams are worth a combined 85% of your grade, and unfortunately, the practice exams do not line up well with the actual exams. There is a textbook, but you'll never use it.

Terribly disorganized and disproportionate amount of work for an "easy A", which it is turning out not to be. Grades were not inputted until the last week of class, which makes it hard to know how you're standing in the class. Boring content, mandatory attendance, really did not learn anything. There are much better options out there to take.

Not worth it for an easy A econ elective. Disproportionate amount of work, and the class content is much less entertaining than you go in expecting it to be. Certain classes are mandatory, his lectures are dry, and there is an excessive amount of writing involved. Look into other options.

Most boring class I've ever had to sit through. The material is incredibly simple/easy (if you've taken principles) yet he somehow makes the tests impossible. His MC questions are all trick questions and they're very often incorrect, don't be afraid to contest his answers. Also, you get a participation grade in a lecture of 200+ students

Lecture could sometimes get boring but overall solid professor who made the material very easy to understand. Tests arent bad and usually had an average of around a 90% which is pretty good. Definitely can do well in this class and learn a lot! Also looking back I wish I had stressed less about the term paper because its not a big deal.

This class was awful. Lectures are long and dry. And extremely hard to pay attention to. Gives out practice exams that are MUCH easier than the actual exams! Final is worth 35% of your grade too. Have pop quizzes that can help as extra credit though. Bill talks way too fast and its hard to even take notes in lecture. Overall, would not recommend!

This class consisted of 2 midterms, about 5 homework assignments, and a final. Participation is not required, but there are 5 pop quizzes that count towards extra credit. Bills lecture can be very long and hard to focus on. A lot of times the tests were harder than the practice exams posted online. Talks super fast, and hard to even take notes!

Honestly the rudest, most disrespectful professor I've had here. Easy A but not worth having to take this guy's class again. Opens the class bragging about his education, which doesn't really matter since he can't teach.
Overall pretty eh teacher. Midterms are not related to homeworks and barely related to the class. Studied hours and hours to get mediocre grade.

While Bill White's class is mainly long lectures, it is possible to get a good grade. Bill uploads all of the lecture slides to Carmen, which is nice to review before a test. Attendance isn't mandatory, but there are 5 in-class quizzes which count as extra points towards your final grade. Neither the homework nor the exams were extremely difficult.

Dr. White's class is very lecture heavy, but if you review the notes, it is possible to get a good grade. It is a bit boring, but he is generally fair. The homeworks are graded harshly, but the exams are not horrible. He does not take attendence but there are 4 in-class pop quizzes that count as a participation grade.
the most awful professorever, no respect, give boring lecture,

Lectures are boring and his voice is annoying. Speaks fast and you'll need to go to him to get him to explain some concepts that he glazes over. His questions come out of the teacher manual that goes with the textbook and oftentimes, he has realized that questions and the possible answers are plain wrong. Don't be afraid to contest your grade.

Bill White was a great professor. He is always was prepared for class and his lectures were very structured. Some people consider hi s lectures boring but I think he does a great job presenting the material. He is always there for help, not handouts. His homework is a large part of the grade but they are challenging. Study the powerpoints for exams

Super nice guy! Powerpoints are easy to understand.. Midterms are straightforward (second midterm is slightly challenging). Class is boring but thats Econ for you and he gives bonus points for pop quizzes that you get 100% on for simply turning them in. Super clear on grading criteria. Easy A-/B+
Boring lecture and awful teacher
He gave low grades though you study hard
No clear criteria for grading

I really enjoy William's lectures. He is very kind and caring. I'm not an economics major, but he has made this class interesting for me. I would definitely take him again. He gives five random quizzes and each one you take adds 1% to your grade which is easily my favorite thing any professor has done.

Easily the most boring professor I've had at OSU. Lectures are so useless it is impossible to attend his absurd participatory class. Material is striaght forward, but he will have test questions with answers that "he feels is most correct." Hopefully will never have this professor again.

Lectures couldn't possibly be more boring. He's very interested in what he's teaching, but if you're not then good luck. I passed without ever opening the textbook. He puts all the slides online but if you skip you will miss the pop quizzes which could really help your grade

His lectures are boring but if you attend and then look back at the powerpoints later it will begin to make sense. He knows his stuff but doesn't do a very good job at relaying that to the students without putting them to sleep.
Gets to the point and test material can be found on online lecture slides. Study a little and the class is not hard.

William knows his stuff. He is very smart, and has real world experience. You need to go to class, because he clears stuff up. As long as you pay attention, he gives good information about real world economics. It can be boring, but he gives extra credit quizzes towards the end of classes, and these are an easy 10 points as long as it is completed.

I'm not sure why he isn't rated higher, his class was the single easiest A I have had for my business major, I literally got a 99% in the class. He wants everyone to get an A and makes it extremely easy to do so, it was truly a cake walk, but we still learned a lot about the underground economy. If you're looking for an easy A, look no further.
Amazing lecturer! Example goes beyond textbooks, and explain all the material clearly and logically. Always willing to help after class.
Super Awesome dude. Makes the class enjoyable (at least he tries). Super Caring but strict. Knows his stuff

Dr. White is a super nice guy, a great teacher, and sorta funny.  He has tons of super applicable real-world experience and tells cool stories occasionally.  He is very helpful during office hours and clearly cares about students and economics.
He is a solid teacher and an awesome guy with a crazy amount of real-world experience.

Go to class! I know he can be boring, but I went and then copied the notes from the powerpoint later.  PS, the homework is super important, so do well on that, and you'll be fine. Plus, he drops the lowest homework, and gives extra credit. Seriously, some test questions come from the HW. Also, go to office hours! He gave away some of the answers.

Dr. White clearly cares a lot about his students. He is very willing to meet with you and the class itself isn't bad if you just pay attention during lecture. The homework assignments help prepare you very well for the exams. He also gives quizzes that are graded based on completion and count as extra credit, and his final was open textbook!

He's really nice and if you ever need help don't hesitate to email him or go in for office hours and he will be more than willing to help you. expect homework, they're hard but helps you prepare for tests. Quizzes are only for extra credit.  Great teacher overall. If you actually put in efforts you will for sure get an A. It's really not that hard.

I personally loved Professor White. This Freakonomics course was a great informal intro to economics for someone outside the department. There is quite a bit of writing but it is based off of opinion and relating it to the lectures. Class was fairly easy, A on the midterm without studying, low homework scores dropped. VERY helpful in office hours.

I would gladly take a class with him again. While his lectures aren't particularly entertaining, you can tell that he cares about the subject and his students. His exams aren't difficult as long as you go to class and pay attention. He also offers pop quizzes that just count for extra credit. Reading the book is not mandatory.
His organization is terrible and also had very boring lectures.  He wasn't clear on what he wanted from his students.
He's hard but gives out many extra credit. also the homework are helpful for the exams.
There are better professors that a university should hire. This guys isn't very clear on what he wants from the students in class. I think he might be at his early stages of teaching or something.
Terrible teacher, he also is extremely unorganized and has his students teach the class so he doesn't have to.

Mr. White was very clear and concise. Econ professors are usually very vague about what they are going to test you on, but Mr. White did a great job on preparing his students for the tests. Participation isn't mandatory. Four HW assignments and a few pop quizzes that don't count against you, he uses those points as EC.

Literally only taught through McGraw-Hill and there was no assistance from the professor at all. No lectures were recorded and you were expected to teach yourself the entire course through the website. Strongly suggest against this class unless you want to pay for the class and then repay to get the book/classwork on McGraw-Hill.

This class is really weird. He was my professor but hes basically only there for announcements and telling the class that you can set up zoom appointments if theres anything you want to clarify. Thats it. Course is taught by McGraw-Hill Connect. MH connect also makes the exams. You might wanna read the textbook in order to pass

The coursework is done through McGraw-Hill so he doesn't teach anything. It's 100 percent Asynchronous course with most of the grades coming from the exam. He doesn't allow any sort of notes from the class to help you in thexam and requires to install a proctorio to spy before taking the exam. Makes it really difficult for you to pass the class.

He definitely is a ridiculous professor, and he didnt teach anything. When you ask him questions, His answers are very unkindly and impatient every time. The class average grade of the final exam was 58% which is worse than F. Moreover, He does not curve any grades, even you got 89.99% that you still will receive B+. STEP AWAY FROM HIM!!!

I just don't know where to begin. This course was 100% online. Sergei was very clear on grading and expectation from day 1. States, if you earn a 89.99% won't bum up grade or curve. More than 50% of coursework is exams. The final was brutal and unexpected. Completely uses the mcgraw hill system so be ready to learn on your own. Fast email replies.

I hated the course material, but Sergei was super helpful at office hours and really knowledgeable! I finished the class .5 points away from receiving an A- and he added the extra .5 to my grade so I could get that instead of a B+
Had him as a TA for macroeconomics. Learned far more from him then our professor. Knows what he's doing and is great a conveying the messages.

Refused to post past papers and mark schemes after changing the course. Uni forced her to and put basic qs like define a good and basic algebra on the mock. Got a first in the end but did more work than any other module, including those i got higher % in. Also was my diss supervisor and refused to help in the month before, cos she was on hols
Great teacher
Her lectures are boring and she posts the homework 24-48 hours before its due so hopefully you didnt have other commitments. She doesnt really answer the questions you ask her either.

She tries to trick students during class and on the exams/quizzes. She has redicilous rules and makes the class much harder than it already is. Her exams and quizzes are moderate to difficult. She doesn't offer any bonus points and is very strict with the layout of the class. I wouldn't suggest her class to anyone.

Nesli is a great econometrician. She knows the ins and outs of the material and is very helpful when you seek her out.  The exams, quizzes, and homework are tricky but if you attend class and work hard, an A is achievable. Beware, the course is ranked which means that 10% of the class gets an A, 20% gets a B, etc.
She's obssessed with tricking students and baiting them in exams then teaching them how to avoid these baits and mistakes. Exams have different format then lecture notes, beware.
Econometrics is one of the hardest class for econ majors, but she makes it easy for everybody
Excellent econometrics professor..

I took his class, and while he wasn't exactly the best English speaker. He answered all of my emails and was lenient towards the end of the class with grading. Tough it out in the beginning, and it gets better towards the end. I also suspect he was the smartest graduate student since he got assigned another hard class in the Fall.

60% grade from Final Paper and Presentation; No clear instruction on how to access the software required at beginning with the instruction is only provided til almost midterm; Revised deadline when one week later than schedule without dropping any assignment, making lots of HW for the last 5 weeks; Recommend to take ECON4400 with OTHER instructor.

Genuinely the worst instructor I have taken a course with. You are better off reading relevant sections of the textbook(which is great) than attempting to parse through anything he says. Condescension is pretty par for the course in economics, but the amount of disrespect he shows towards undergrads is ridiculous. Good topics, terrible teacher.

Understands the field of economics very well and uses current examples. Extremely generous with grading through extra credit assignments and the potential to drop one midterm. Used AU20 semester Zooms as lecture videos. Attendance only required in 1st class. Exams were slightly vague but never unfair. Communicates course expectations very clearly.

Genuinely cares for success of his students, knowing fully the difficulty of the course material. Can move fast in lectures but very accessible outside of class. Usually 1-2 assignments a week between a problem set and worksheet. 3 exams and we got to drop our lowest score. This is a tough course but Senad gives students a great chance.

He did not even try to simplify the course for our level of knowledge. Condescending and talked over our heads. He had nice energy in class, but I would not take his course again. Maybe econ wasnt for me, I dont know

I know there are a lot of mixed reviews regarding Dr. S, but I did not have the best experience with his class. The quizzes & exams were very difficult and the lectures were quite boring and could be unhelpful. The weighted grade distribution isn't fair (IMO) either. Getting an A is really hard.

Professor Sinanovic is probably the worst professor I've had thus far at OSU. He uses previous semester recordings for lecture, he is awful at explaining the material, and words his quiz and exam questions TERRIBLY. Avoid at all costs. I'm basically learning Econ from Youtube.
This professor doesn't deserve to be paid. He puts out old lecture videos, takes weeks to grade simple things, and doesn't respond to his emails. Worst professor I've had.

The material taught in this course is not hard if you'r knowledgeable in statistics. But Senad is definitely one of the laziest teachers Ive ever had. Even during a pandemic, he refuses to make time for his students to have full live lectures, but rather, post recordings of lectures from previous semesters which creates much inconsistency for exams

His class is doable if you put the work in. Going to office hours and asking questions helps tremendously. I've heard that he is one of the easier econ professors, and I would have done better in this class if I put more effort in, so it wasn't too difficult.

This was a difficult class but not impossible. He is tough but fair, and wants to see you succeed. Don't be afraid to ask questions and go to office hours! I asked a lot of dumb questions this semester but he was patient and helped me understand. Also - don't put the project off to the last minute. Took a lot more work than I expected.

He goes over things so fast and expects you to just know it. His questions make no sense.. you barely have time to think about what you read and his explanations are like assume this even if its not in the question but then somethings youre wrong if you assume. unless you already have experience in economics FOR THIS INTRO CLASS dont take it

Dr Sinanovic really cares that his students learn the material. Sometimes he comes off demanding but thats because a lot of the stuff he teaches is difficult to learn and he knows it takes a lot of practice. I can absolutely say I learned a lot from Dr Sinanovic.

I really liked Dr. Sinanovic. He made lectures really interesting and easy to understand. Very engaging and good at connecting things to real life. His tests were kind of difficult, but if you understand the graphs he shows, you should be good.
Avoid at all costs

Expects you to learn almost 70% of the main ideas, and practices of the course on your own and how to apply them. Tests are not terrible unless you are literally reading every chapter, watching all the review videos, and completing all the practice tests and quizzes CONSISTENTLY. If you miss a chapter or just don't care enough you're screwed.

He expects you to teach yourself 80% of the course and he should only cover 10-20%. His exams are way harder than what he goes over in class. He never shows you how to apply the new concepts to actual problems. I do not recommend taking this course with him.

Hes know his stuff but doesnt know how to teach to students. Expects that we taken economics prior to this course and that we are experts. Exams are confusing and had to be regraded several times. Go to office hours is no help as he criticize you for not knowing a topic. No recitation. Dont do it.

He explains basic concepts but never shows how to apply this to the problems on his exams and quizzes. It makes figuring things out incredibly difficult. He admits that his European style of algebra is very different from American math so the one time that he has walked us through a problem, it was very confusing and did not help.

Senad is a great teacher. He clearly wants his students to learn. He is very helpful in office hours. If you have problem with the materials, just stop in his office hours. His exams are very similar to the practice and homework questions. I would take him again.

This professor thought he is Ph.D and do some Shabi Caozuo every time. Guys, do you ever see a sample with 160 questions? 6-8 videos every week and 2 hws on sapling every week, all count for credits. I don't know why he asks us to watch the MRU videos which do much more better than him and he asks us to go to the class. He finds Cunzaigan everyday

Professor Sinanovic is accessible during office hours and really cares whether you understand the content thoroughly. The prerequisite for ECON 4400, which is STAT 2450, have most of content overlapped. So if you took STAT 2450, this course is barely easy. He is not that good in explaining things very clear but you can understand what he is saying.

His class is a lot of work and relatively hard, but if you put in the work and participate hes one of the best professors you can have; hes very passionate and knowledgeable in Econ. Hopefully I can get him again!
Very difficult class.

This PhD's class is harder than other Econ 4400 not only in the exam but also has heavy homework and project. His exam have a lot of content cover many knowledge points and also have so many questions. Before the exam, he will not give you any sample and he usually make mistake in his slide, sample questions in the class and homework answer.
A really difficult class

He's a good professor. ECON in general is hard so you have to put forth some effort if you want a decent grade but he gave us multiple chances for extra credit throughout the semester and also curved some tests if the average was low. Lectures are nothing special but he tries to make it a little fun.

He is a good professor and seems to care about his students but he definitely makes you work for your grade. Going to lecture is extremely helpful. If you get behind/ don't stay with the material you won't get a good grade in the class. The midterms and final are worth most of your grade.

Prof. Sinanovic is one of the best, if not the best professors I've had at OSU so far! He truly cares about the material and his students, and will explain things you don't understand. His accent may be difficult to get used to at first, but it isn't so bad. Lecture heavy, grade depended on exams, quizzes, and online hw. Gave some extra credit

I had him for Econ 2001. He genuinely has a passion for teaching and is really willing to help his students. I actually found the class fairly easy, but I was in the top 5% ignoring my terrible homework grades (which is my own fault). He does not take attendance but has in-class quizzes and questions for grades + lecture material is the exam.

Exams make up most of ur grade, but if you dont know what ur doing in class and fail an exam, most likely wont pass. Things you actually do good on only count as a small percentage of your grade. The way he explains material is confusing so you have to learn mostly everything yourself or go to a tutor.

This was my first economics class and it wasn't bad. Lectures are not mandatory but are useful. He really wants his students to understand economics and he wants to help as best as he can. There are 3 midterm tests (lowest score on midterm is dropped) and a final; 7 quizzes (2 lowest scores are dropped).

He is the absolute worst teacher I've ever had. Whatever you do, DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS. I've spend endless hours studying and no matter what I do there is no possible way to do well. His worksheets and tests are poorly worded and have many errors. I went to his office hours and asked him for help and he said there was nothing he could do for me.

Lectures are helpful with understanding of the material. If you show up to lecture, take his practice exams, and read the textbook you will do well in his class. His office hours are very beneficial and he is willing to make appointments if you cannot make his office hours but have questions. Also offers a review session for his exams.

Professor Sinanovic makes Micro Economics a nice and interesting course. He's friendly, and he is willing to help make sure you understand the material. He's great at office hours too especially before exams. He sets everyone up to get an A or high B if you do all the homework and quizzes. If you put the time in, then you'll do fine.

Probably the best professor I have had yet at OSU! His lectures are great, easy to understand, and he makes all the material very interesting. He is a tough grader, but he posts practice exam, and ask same or very similar questions on the exam. He is easy to understand, and structures the class in a very logical way.

Prof. S is easily the best professor in the department. His lectures are easy to follow, engaging, and sometimes entertaining. If you show up and pay attention to lecture, you'll pass with flying colors. Take any class of his that you can

Spelling errors on class presentations, and tests. Mistakes made when reviewing test material, errors on practice tests, incorrect information presented then tested. Office hours don't seem helpful, he's quick to go over material and quicker to misspeak and imply student error for confusion not haphazard presenting/teaching. Don't take this course.

He goes over the basics & material but doesn't show how to apply it to real problems, which are on the quizzes & tests.
