Homework online every week, quizzes 1-2 times a month, sometimes gives homework in class (he spells stuff wrong on the homework he creates), & half my class is failing. The Econ Learning Center say they get his students a lot.

If you are a student getting ready to graduate and need to fill in the 5000 level criteria you are doing yourself a disservice if econ 5140 w/ dr. logan is not one of them. He is a great teacher and very knowledgeable in econ. It is a lot of work e.g you have to write 6 papers minimum. The exams are curved. If you put in the effort you'll get a B.

Dr. Logan is an absolute beast. He brings undeniable Economics expertise to every class, loves his students, and has deep knowledge of history, demographics, mathematics, the list goes on. You will learn and be exposed to new methods of analysis in his class. GOAT

Professor Logan is a great guy. However, he has very unclear grading criteria and your final grade depends on 3 exams and 4 papers. If you're an econ major, this class is fine to take, but it gets frustrating as the content is incredibly dense and the grading is kind of unclear. Super likable guy though.

Dr. Logan is the best lecturer Ive had at OSU. There are 3 exams, 4 writing assignments, attendance is mandatory. He lectures the readings in class as if you havent read them. He gives study guides, an old exam, and a review session for exams. If you go to class and do the exam reviews you should be able to pull a B or A. Interesting material!

Dr. Logan was a great lecturer. He is clear about what you will be graded on and makes class enjoyable. Attendance was mandatory in our class and technology was not allowed. Take notes, study off the material he posts on line, and write the papers. You will get a B or better just by putting in the time.

Sassy in his lectures but very knowledgeable. One of those you never forget. So funny and a great teacher. Material will be somewhat hard and he's not the easiest grader but take him for a high level econ class. Will always relate subject matter to something funny. A lot of work but show up and work hard you will succeed.

He comes off as someone who's going to grade hard and he's pretty sassy. The test aren't bad his curves on them are money an 80 is an A. There is no textbook, but he assigns a lot of readings that you have to read. Only bad part is the papers, which are just tedious. He is an easier grader tho and you only have to do 8. For a 5000 teacher TAKE HIM

The class is some what challenging but as long as you do the reading you will do fine. class consist of 2 midterms and final.  All test questions are in essay format. i thought he graded fairly. also you will be required to write 4 papers, the papers are a reaction to assign readings, he give you the option of pick the paper. barks hard, bite soft

Logan is strict on following his syllabus. The whole class was planned out almost exactly to what he syllabus says. He had all the readings planned out and is an excellent speaker. Also, super hilarious! Would definitely take a class of his again. 4 papers each 4 pages, 2 midterms, 1 final. All tests were ext response ques. right from exam practice

Class is definitely interesting. The course material can be a little challenging, however, it is not impossible. The difficulty is not a result of his teaching, the material can just be confusing. He always makes his lectures interesting as well as entertaining.

Getting an A in his class is simple: go to class takes notes and read(he lets you miss 5 without any reason or grade deduction which is 2 more than most with attendance) He is extremely knowledgeable about the information he teaches (it all comes from research he has done or is interested in)  if you don't like him its because you're lazy

Dr. Logan is an excellent professor. He is genuinely interested in the subjects he teaches and in his students. Econ 4830 is easy if you always come to class, take good notes. The pop-quizzes are open note and he has great review sessions before each of the exams. I highly recommend taking any of his classes! Great Professor!

He challenges his students but isn't that what school is for? Does an excellent job explaining a complex subject area. Elite review session combined with attendance and solid effort will get most students an A.

Meh. He is a relatively easy grader, but the subject material is pretty dry imo. He does hold review sessions before exams which is cool. 8 unannounced open-note quizzes, drop 3, 2 midterms, and a final are the only grades.
Great class.  Great teaching style. Go to class and do your work and you'll do fine.
I don't like him and his class. He is horrible instructor.

If you try to drop the his class and you discuss about it if he tells you don't drop don't buy it he will change his mind end of the semester and he doesn't look like your professor any more he is like .he is cruel without little mercy and cold blood professor.
He is a horrible professor.

Attendance is mandatory, so if you attend class and take notes, you will pass easily. He gives you practice exams that are usually 3/4 of the real exam, do the questions and you will easily pass the midterms. The paper is a lot easier than he makes it seem, his bark is way worse than his bite. He's a very fair grader on the paper and tests.

I wouldn't suggest ESL students to take Dr. Logan's ECON 4553. He is a good instructor, but he doesn't use textbook... Besides, he has relatively higher requirements on academic writing I think. I only got C in the midterms. However, this class is interesting. He is a humorous teacher.
Excellent professor. I learned a lot. He challenges you but is a fantastic lecturer. One of the best professors I've ever had.

The class is difficult, but the exams are fair. More effort is required and is worth it: the end result of the lectures and the material is the  gaining of an invaluable perspective.  When you really listen, Dr. Logan is brilliant.  He has a very pragmatic viewpoint both on history and on economic reality.  Advice: he can be sarcastic at times but simply ignore it and due your best
somewhat interesting material...but not very helpful in teaching style

I had this professor for Econ 515 and Economic Demography and he is great! He is really smart , enjoyed every one of his lectures. I learned a lot from him and thought about things I have never thought before or never thought in such a way.

The syllabus and his introduction make him sound harder than he is.  He is a nice guy and a fair grader.  He may sound rude because he responds negatively to stupid questions about course structure (eg: is the final cumalitive?).  The paper is easy, no focus on writing style just find a topic with numbers to support something.
Exams are all essay, but not too difficult. He explains material clearly and will answer any questions you have.

Knows his subject a little tooo well... by that i mean he has a lot to say in every lecture and since he doesnt give handouts u gotta write like a maniac... Review sheets pretty much cover everything so they arent the most helpful... but if u study u shold do just fine... decent grader... turned out a lil more intristing than i thought it would be

This class was way better than I thought it would be.  Learned some interesting stuff.  Can be boring at times, but he tries.  Prof. Logan covers a lot in every lecture so you are writing all the time and have to pay attention, but he gives you review sheets for the exams and if you study it you ace the exam.  Fair grader.
Ok class.  Not totally boring, but not exciting either.  A good GEC class if you are a business major.
ssoooo annoying. hate this class. enough said

His bark is louder than his bite.  He says he grades very hard, but he doesn't really.  His lectures are dry (reads them word for word from a paper), but he is very informed on the topics.  He does not encourage questions.  He was not very helpful with the paper, even though he requires you to meet with him twice about it.
The class based entirely on journal articles, exams were fairly difficult, the research paper was the most intense I have been assigned in 3 years of economics.

no notes provided - only downside to the class.  exams are fair and straight forward if you know the material.  all essay - but that gives you more opportunity to get a right answer.  knows his material very well - had to keep up with his lectures b/c he talks so fast but pretty interesting.  a lot better than i expected the class to be

doesn't Use Powerpoint or anything good, uses overheads, be ready to take a lot of notes, hard grader, all exams are strait up writing... BLUE BOOK.  not too bad would be better if he used powerpoint or something not just crappy overhead!

Very good lecturer. Can make you worry sometimes about exams but just wants you to be prepared. Makes the class as fun and interesting as it can be. Not easy but very fair if you do the work. Along with Poast, the best Econ instructor I've had.
